00055 /* @priority: If non-zero, move the selected connection to the list head.
00056  * @create: If zero, only search in existing connections.
00057  */
00058 static int import_set_conn(struct obd_import *imp, struct obd_uuid *uuid,
00059                            int priority, int create)
00060 {
00061         struct ptlrpc_connection *ptlrpc_conn;
00062         struct obd_import_conn *imp_conn = NULL, *item;
00063         int rc = 0;
00064         ENTRY;
00065 
00066         if (!create && !priority) {
00067                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "Nothing to do\n");
00068                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00069         }
00070 
00071         ptlrpc_conn = ptlrpc_uuid_to_connection(uuid);
00072         if (!ptlrpc_conn) {
00073                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "can't find connection %s\n", uuid->uuid);
00074                 RETURN (-ENOENT);
00075         }
00076 
00077         if (create) {
00078                 OBD_ALLOC(imp_conn, sizeof(*imp_conn));
00079                 if (!imp_conn) {
00080                         GOTO(out_put, rc = -ENOMEM);
00081                 }
00082         }
00083 
00084         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00085         list_for_each_entry(item, &imp->imp_conn_list, oic_item) {
00086                 if (obd_uuid_equals(uuid, &item->oic_uuid)) {
00087                         if (priority) {
00088                                 list_del(&item->oic_item);
00089                                 list_add(&item->oic_item,
00090                                              &imp->imp_conn_list);
00091                                 item->oic_last_attempt = 0;
00092                         }
00093                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "imp %p@%s: found existing conn %s%s\n",
00094                                imp, imp->imp_obd->obd_name, uuid->uuid,
00095                                (priority ? ", moved to head" : ""));
00096                         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00097                         GOTO(out_free, rc = 0);
00098                 }
00099         }
00100         /* No existing import connection found for \a uuid. */
00101         if (create) {
00102                 imp_conn->oic_conn = ptlrpc_conn;
00103                 imp_conn->oic_uuid = *uuid;
00104                 imp_conn->oic_last_attempt = 0;
00105                 if (priority)
00106                         list_add(&imp_conn->oic_item, &imp->imp_conn_list);
00107                 else
00108                         list_add_tail(&imp_conn->oic_item,
00109                                           &imp->imp_conn_list);
00110                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "imp %p@%s: add connection %s at %s\n",
00111                        imp, imp->imp_obd->obd_name, uuid->uuid,
00112                        (priority ? "head" : "tail"));
00113         } else {
00114                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00115                 GOTO(out_free, rc = -ENOENT);
00116         }
00117 
00118         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00119         RETURN(0);
00120 out_free:
00121         if (imp_conn)
00122                 OBD_FREE(imp_conn, sizeof(*imp_conn));
00123 out_put:
00124         ptlrpc_connection_put(ptlrpc_conn);
00125         RETURN(rc);
00126 }
00127 
00128 int import_set_conn_priority(struct obd_import *imp, struct obd_uuid *uuid)
00129 {
00130         return import_set_conn(imp, uuid, 1, 0);
00131 }
00132 
00133 int client_import_add_conn(struct obd_import *imp, struct obd_uuid *uuid,
00134                            int priority)
00135 {
00136         return import_set_conn(imp, uuid, priority, 1);
00137 }
00138 EXPORT_SYMBOL(client_import_add_conn);
00139 
00140 int client_import_del_conn(struct obd_import *imp, struct obd_uuid *uuid)
00141 {
00142         struct obd_import_conn *imp_conn;
00143         struct obd_export *dlmexp;
00144         int rc = -ENOENT;
00145         ENTRY;
00146 
00147         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00148         if (list_empty(&imp->imp_conn_list)) {
00149                 LASSERT(!imp->imp_connection);
00150                 GOTO(out, rc);
00151         }
00152 
00153         list_for_each_entry(imp_conn, &imp->imp_conn_list, oic_item) {
00154                 if (!obd_uuid_equals(uuid, &imp_conn->oic_uuid))
00155                         continue;
00156                 LASSERT(imp_conn->oic_conn);
00157 
00158                 if (imp_conn == imp->imp_conn_current) {
00159                         LASSERT(imp_conn->oic_conn == imp->imp_connection);
00160 
00161                         if (imp->imp_state != LUSTRE_IMP_CLOSED &&
00162                             imp->imp_state != LUSTRE_IMP_DISCON) {
00163                                 CERROR("can't remove current connection\n");
00164                                 GOTO(out, rc = -EBUSY);
00165                         }
00166 
00167                         ptlrpc_connection_put(imp->imp_connection);
00168                         imp->imp_connection = NULL;
00169 
00170                         dlmexp = class_conn2export(&imp->imp_dlm_handle);
00171                         if (dlmexp && dlmexp->exp_connection) {
00172                                 LASSERT(dlmexp->exp_connection ==
00173                                         imp_conn->oic_conn);
00174                                 ptlrpc_connection_put(dlmexp->exp_connection);
00175                                 dlmexp->exp_connection = NULL;
00176                         }
00177                 }
00178 
00179                 list_del(&imp_conn->oic_item);
00180                 ptlrpc_connection_put(imp_conn->oic_conn);
00181                 OBD_FREE(imp_conn, sizeof(*imp_conn));
00182                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "imp %p@%s: remove connection %s\n",
00183                        imp, imp->imp_obd->obd_name, uuid->uuid);
00184                 rc = 0;
00185                 break;
00186         }
00187 out:
00188         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00189         if (rc == -ENOENT)
00190                 CERROR("connection %s not found\n", uuid->uuid);
00191         RETURN(rc);
00192 }
00193 EXPORT_SYMBOL(client_import_del_conn);
00194 
00199 int client_import_find_conn(struct obd_import *imp, lnet_nid_t peer,
00200                             struct obd_uuid *uuid)
00201 {
00202         struct obd_import_conn *conn;
00203         int rc = -ENOENT;
00204         ENTRY;
00205 
00206         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00207         list_for_each_entry(conn, &imp->imp_conn_list, oic_item) {
00208                 /* Check if conn UUID does have this peer NID. */
00209                 if (class_check_uuid(&conn->oic_uuid, peer)) {
00210                         *uuid = conn->oic_uuid;
00211                         rc = 0;
00212                         break;
00213                 }
00214         }
00215         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00216         RETURN(rc);
00217 }
00218 EXPORT_SYMBOL(client_import_find_conn);
00219 
00220 void client_destroy_import(struct obd_import *imp)
00221 {
00222         /* Drop security policy instance after all RPCs have finished/aborted
00223          * to let all busy contexts be released. */
00224         class_import_get(imp);
00225         class_destroy_import(imp);
00226         sptlrpc_import_sec_put(imp);
00227         class_import_put(imp);
00228 }
00229 EXPORT_SYMBOL(client_destroy_import);
00230 
00240 static int osc_on_mdt(char *obdname)
00241 {
00242         char *ptr;
00243 
00244         ptr = strrchr(obdname, '-');
00245         if (ptr == NULL)
00246                 return 0;
00247 
00248         if (strncmp(ptr + 1, "MDT", 3) == 0)
00249                 return 1;
00250 
00251         return 0;
00252 }
00253 
00254 /* Configure an RPC client OBD device.
00255  *
00256  * lcfg parameters:
00257  * 1 - client UUID
00258  * 2 - server UUID
00259  * 3 - inactive-on-startup
00260  */
00261 int client_obd_setup(struct obd_device *obddev, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00262 {
00263         struct client_obd *cli = &obddev->u.cli;
00264         struct obd_import *imp;
00265         struct obd_uuid server_uuid;
00266         int rq_portal, rp_portal, connect_op;
00267         char *name = obddev->obd_type->typ_name;
00268         enum ldlm_ns_type ns_type = LDLM_NS_TYPE_UNKNOWN;
00269         char *cli_name = lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 0);
00270         int rc;
00271         ENTRY;
00272 
00273         /* In a more perfect world, we would hang a ptlrpc_client off of
00274          * obd_type and just use the values from there. */
00275         if (!strcmp(name, LUSTRE_OSC_NAME)) {
00276                 rq_portal = OST_REQUEST_PORTAL;
00277                 rp_portal = OSC_REPLY_PORTAL;
00278                 connect_op = OST_CONNECT;
00279                 cli->cl_sp_me = LUSTRE_SP_CLI;
00280                 cli->cl_sp_to = LUSTRE_SP_OST;
00281                 ns_type = LDLM_NS_TYPE_OSC;
00282         } else if (!strcmp(name, LUSTRE_MDC_NAME) ||
00283                    !strcmp(name, LUSTRE_LWP_NAME)) {
00284                 rq_portal = MDS_REQUEST_PORTAL;
00285                 rp_portal = MDC_REPLY_PORTAL;
00286                 connect_op = MDS_CONNECT;
00287                 if (is_lwp_on_ost(cli_name))
00288                         cli->cl_sp_me = LUSTRE_SP_OST;
00289                 else if (is_lwp_on_mdt(cli_name))
00290                         cli->cl_sp_me = LUSTRE_SP_MDT;
00291                 else
00292                         cli->cl_sp_me = LUSTRE_SP_CLI;
00293                 cli->cl_sp_to = LUSTRE_SP_MDT;
00294                 ns_type = LDLM_NS_TYPE_MDC;
00295         } else if (!strcmp(name, LUSTRE_OSP_NAME)) {
00296                 if (strstr(lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 1), "OST") == NULL) {
00297                         /* OSP_on_MDT for other MDTs */
00298                         connect_op = MDS_CONNECT;
00299                         cli->cl_sp_to = LUSTRE_SP_MDT;
00300                         ns_type = LDLM_NS_TYPE_MDC;
00301                         rq_portal = OUT_PORTAL;
00302                 } else {
00303                         /* OSP on MDT for OST */
00304                         connect_op = OST_CONNECT;
00305                         cli->cl_sp_to = LUSTRE_SP_OST;
00306                         ns_type = LDLM_NS_TYPE_OSC;
00307                         rq_portal = OST_REQUEST_PORTAL;
00308                 }
00309                 rp_portal = OSC_REPLY_PORTAL;
00310                 cli->cl_sp_me = LUSTRE_SP_MDT;
00311         } else if (!strcmp(name, LUSTRE_MGC_NAME)) {
00312                 rq_portal = MGS_REQUEST_PORTAL;
00313                 rp_portal = MGC_REPLY_PORTAL;
00314                 connect_op = MGS_CONNECT;
00315                 cli->cl_sp_me = LUSTRE_SP_MGC;
00316                 cli->cl_sp_to = LUSTRE_SP_MGS;
00317                 cli->cl_flvr_mgc.sf_rpc = SPTLRPC_FLVR_INVALID;
00318                 ns_type = LDLM_NS_TYPE_MGC;
00319         } else {
00320                 CERROR("unknown client OBD type \"%s\", can't setup\n",
00321                        name);
00322                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00323         }
00324 
00325         if (LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1) < 1) {
00326                 CERROR("requires a TARGET UUID\n");
00327                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00328         }
00329 
00330         if (LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1) > 37) {
00331                 CERROR("client UUID must be less than 38 characters\n");
00332                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00333         }
00334 
00335         if (LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 2) < 1) {
00336                 CERROR("setup requires a SERVER UUID\n");
00337                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00338         }
00339 
00340         if (LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 2) > 37) {
00341                 CERROR("target UUID must be less than 38 characters\n");
00342                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00343         }
00344 
00345         init_rwsem(&cli->cl_sem);
00346         mutex_init(&cli->cl_mgc_mutex);
00347         cli->cl_conn_count = 0;
00348         memcpy(server_uuid.uuid, lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 2),
00349                min_t(unsigned int, LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 2),
00350                      sizeof(server_uuid)));
00351 
00352         cli->cl_dirty_pages = 0;
00353         cli->cl_avail_grant = 0;
00354         /* FIXME: Should limit this for the sum of all cl_dirty_max_pages. */
00355         /* cl_dirty_max_pages may be changed at connect time in
00356          * ptlrpc_connect_interpret(). */
00357         client_adjust_max_dirty(cli);
00358         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&cli->cl_cache_waiters);
00359         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&cli->cl_loi_ready_list);
00360         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&cli->cl_loi_hp_ready_list);
00361         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&cli->cl_loi_write_list);
00362         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&cli->cl_loi_read_list);
00363         spin_lock_init(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00364         atomic_set(&cli->cl_pending_w_pages, 0);
00365         atomic_set(&cli->cl_pending_r_pages, 0);
00366         cli->cl_r_in_flight = 0;
00367         cli->cl_w_in_flight = 0;
00368 
00369         spin_lock_init(&cli->cl_read_rpc_hist.oh_lock);
00370         spin_lock_init(&cli->cl_write_rpc_hist.oh_lock);
00371         spin_lock_init(&cli->cl_read_page_hist.oh_lock);
00372         spin_lock_init(&cli->cl_write_page_hist.oh_lock);
00373         spin_lock_init(&cli->cl_read_offset_hist.oh_lock);
00374         spin_lock_init(&cli->cl_write_offset_hist.oh_lock);
00375 
00376         /* lru for osc. */
00377         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&cli->cl_lru_osc);
00378         atomic_set(&cli->cl_lru_shrinkers, 0);
00379         atomic_long_set(&cli->cl_lru_busy, 0);
00380         atomic_long_set(&cli->cl_lru_in_list, 0);
00381         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&cli->cl_lru_list);
00382         spin_lock_init(&cli->cl_lru_list_lock);
00383         atomic_long_set(&cli->cl_unstable_count, 0);
00384         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&cli->cl_shrink_list);
00385 
00386         init_waitqueue_head(&cli->cl_destroy_waitq);
00387         atomic_set(&cli->cl_destroy_in_flight, 0);
00388 #ifdef ENABLE_CHECKSUM
00389         /* Turn on checksumming by default. */
00390         cli->cl_checksum = 1;
00391         /*
00392          * The supported checksum types will be worked out at connect time
00393          * Set cl_chksum* to CRC32 for now to avoid returning screwed info
00394          * through procfs.
00395          */
00396         cli->cl_cksum_type = cli->cl_supp_cksum_types = OBD_CKSUM_CRC32;
00397 #endif
00398         atomic_set(&cli->cl_resends, OSC_DEFAULT_RESENDS);
00399 
00400         /* Set it to possible maximum size. It may be reduced by ocd_brw_size
00401          * from OFD after connecting. */
00402         cli->cl_max_pages_per_rpc = PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_PAGES;
00403 
00404         /* set cl_chunkbits default value to PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT,
00405          * it will be updated at OSC connection time. */
00406         cli->cl_chunkbits = PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00407 
00408         if (!strcmp(name, LUSTRE_MDC_NAME)) {
00409                 cli->cl_max_rpcs_in_flight = OBD_MAX_RIF_DEFAULT;
00410         } else if (totalram_pages >> (20 - PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT) <= 128 /* MB */) {
00411                 cli->cl_max_rpcs_in_flight = 2;
00412         } else if (totalram_pages >> (20 - PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT) <= 256 /* MB */) {
00413                 cli->cl_max_rpcs_in_flight = 3;
00414         } else if (totalram_pages >> (20 - PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT) <= 512 /* MB */) {
00415                 cli->cl_max_rpcs_in_flight = 4;
00416         } else {
00417                 if (osc_on_mdt(obddev->obd_name))
00418                         cli->cl_max_rpcs_in_flight = OBD_MAX_RIF_MAX;
00419                 else
00420                         cli->cl_max_rpcs_in_flight = OBD_MAX_RIF_DEFAULT;
00421         }
00422 
00423         spin_lock_init(&cli->cl_mod_rpcs_lock);
00424         spin_lock_init(&cli->cl_mod_rpcs_hist.oh_lock);
00425         cli->cl_max_mod_rpcs_in_flight = 0;
00426         cli->cl_mod_rpcs_in_flight = 0;
00427         cli->cl_close_rpcs_in_flight = 0;
00428         init_waitqueue_head(&cli->cl_mod_rpcs_waitq);
00429         cli->cl_mod_tag_bitmap = NULL;
00430 
00431         if (connect_op == MDS_CONNECT) {
00432                 cli->cl_max_mod_rpcs_in_flight = cli->cl_max_rpcs_in_flight - 1;
00433                 OBD_ALLOC(cli->cl_mod_tag_bitmap,
00434                           BITS_TO_LONGS(OBD_MAX_RIF_MAX) * sizeof(long));
00435                 if (cli->cl_mod_tag_bitmap == NULL)
00436                         GOTO(err, rc = -ENOMEM);
00437         }
00438 
00439         rc = ldlm_get_ref();
00440         if (rc) {
00441                 CERROR("ldlm_get_ref failed: %d\n", rc);
00442                 GOTO(err, rc);
00443         }
00444 
00445         ptlrpc_init_client(rq_portal, rp_portal, name,
00446                            &obddev->obd_ldlm_client);
00447 
00448         imp = class_new_import(obddev);
00449         if (imp == NULL)
00450                 GOTO(err_ldlm, rc = -ENOENT);
00451         imp->imp_client = &obddev->obd_ldlm_client;
00452         imp->imp_connect_op = connect_op;
00453         memcpy(cli->cl_target_uuid.uuid, lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 1),
00454                LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1));
00455         class_import_put(imp);
00456 
00457         rc = client_import_add_conn(imp, &server_uuid, 1);
00458         if (rc) {
00459                 CERROR("can't add initial connection\n");
00460                 GOTO(err_import, rc);
00461         }
00462 
00463         cli->cl_import = imp;
00464         /* cli->cl_max_mds_easize updated by mdc_init_ea_size() */
00465         cli->cl_max_mds_easize = sizeof(struct lov_mds_md_v3);
00466 
00467         if (LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 3) > 0) {
00468                 if (!strcmp(lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 3), "inactive")) {
00469                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "marking %s %s->%s as inactive\n",
00470                                name, obddev->obd_name,
00471                                cli->cl_target_uuid.uuid);
00472                         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00473                         imp->imp_deactive = 1;
00474                         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00475                 }
00476         }
00477 
00478         obddev->obd_namespace = ldlm_namespace_new(obddev, obddev->obd_name,
00479                                                    LDLM_NAMESPACE_CLIENT,
00480                                                    LDLM_NAMESPACE_GREEDY,
00481                                                    ns_type);
00482         if (obddev->obd_namespace == NULL) {
00483                 CERROR("Unable to create client namespace - %s\n",
00484                        obddev->obd_name);
00485                 GOTO(err_import, rc = -ENOMEM);
00486         }
00487 
00488         RETURN(rc);
00489 
00490 err_import:
00491         class_destroy_import(imp);
00492 err_ldlm:
00493         ldlm_put_ref();
00494 err:
00495         if (cli->cl_mod_tag_bitmap != NULL)
00496                 OBD_FREE(cli->cl_mod_tag_bitmap,
00497                          BITS_TO_LONGS(OBD_MAX_RIF_MAX) * sizeof(long));
00498         cli->cl_mod_tag_bitmap = NULL;
00499         RETURN(rc);
00500 
00501 }
00502 EXPORT_SYMBOL(client_obd_setup);
00503 
00504 int client_obd_cleanup(struct obd_device *obddev)
00505 {
00506         struct client_obd *cli = &obddev->u.cli;
00507         ENTRY;
00508 
00509         ldlm_namespace_free_post(obddev->obd_namespace);
00510         obddev->obd_namespace = NULL;
00511 
00512         obd_cleanup_client_import(obddev);
00513         LASSERT(obddev->u.cli.cl_import == NULL);
00514 
00515         ldlm_put_ref();
00516 
00517         if (cli->cl_mod_tag_bitmap != NULL)
00518                 OBD_FREE(cli->cl_mod_tag_bitmap,
00519                          BITS_TO_LONGS(OBD_MAX_RIF_MAX) * sizeof(long));
00520         cli->cl_mod_tag_bitmap = NULL;
00521 
00522         RETURN(0);
00523 }
00524 EXPORT_SYMBOL(client_obd_cleanup);
00525 
00526 /* ->o_connect() method for client side (OSC and MDC and MGC) */
00527 int client_connect_import(const struct lu_env *env,
00528                           struct obd_export **exp,
00529                           struct obd_device *obd, struct obd_uuid *cluuid,
00530                           struct obd_connect_data *data, void *localdata)
00531 {
00532         struct client_obd       *cli    = &obd->u.cli;
00533         struct obd_import       *imp    = cli->cl_import;
00534         struct obd_connect_data *ocd;
00535         struct lustre_handle    conn    = { 0 };
00536         int                     rc;
00537         bool                    is_mdc = false;
00538         ENTRY;
00539 
00540         *exp = NULL;
00541         down_write(&cli->cl_sem);
00542         if (cli->cl_conn_count > 0)
00543                 GOTO(out_sem, rc = -EALREADY);
00544 
00545         rc = class_connect(&conn, obd, cluuid);
00546         if (rc)
00547                 GOTO(out_sem, rc);
00548 
00549         cli->cl_conn_count++;
00550         *exp = class_conn2export(&conn);
00551 
00552         LASSERT(obd->obd_namespace);
00553 
00554         imp->imp_dlm_handle = conn;
00555         rc = ptlrpc_init_import(imp);
00556         if (rc != 0)
00557                 GOTO(out_ldlm, rc);
00558 
00559         ocd = &imp->imp_connect_data;
00560         if (data) {
00561                 *ocd = *data;
00562                 is_mdc = strncmp(imp->imp_obd->obd_type->typ_name,
00563                                  LUSTRE_MDC_NAME, 3) == 0;
00564                 if (is_mdc)
00565                         data->ocd_connect_flags |= OBD_CONNECT_MULTIMODRPCS;
00566                 imp->imp_connect_flags_orig = data->ocd_connect_flags;
00567         }
00568 
00569         rc = ptlrpc_connect_import(imp);
00570         if (rc != 0) {
00571                 LASSERT (imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_DISCON);
00572                 GOTO(out_ldlm, rc);
00573         }
00574         LASSERT(*exp != NULL && (*exp)->exp_connection);
00575 
00576         if (data) {
00577                 LASSERTF((ocd->ocd_connect_flags & data->ocd_connect_flags) ==
00578                          ocd->ocd_connect_flags, "old "LPX64", new "LPX64"\n",
00579                          data->ocd_connect_flags, ocd->ocd_connect_flags);
00580                 data->ocd_connect_flags = ocd->ocd_connect_flags;
00581                 /* clear the flag as it was not set and is not known
00582                  * by upper layers */
00583                 if (is_mdc)
00584                         data->ocd_connect_flags &= ~OBD_CONNECT_MULTIMODRPCS;
00585         }
00586 
00587         ptlrpc_pinger_add_import(imp);
00588 
00589         EXIT;
00590 
00591         if (rc) {
00592 out_ldlm:
00593                 cli->cl_conn_count--;
00594                 class_disconnect(*exp);
00595                 *exp = NULL;
00596         }
00597 out_sem:
00598         up_write(&cli->cl_sem);
00599 
00600         return rc;
00601 }
00602 EXPORT_SYMBOL(client_connect_import);
00603 
00604 int client_disconnect_export(struct obd_export *exp)
00605 {
00606         struct obd_device *obd = class_exp2obd(exp);
00607         struct client_obd *cli;
00608         struct obd_import *imp;
00609         int rc = 0, err;
00610         ENTRY;
00611 
00612         if (!obd) {
00613                 CERROR("invalid export for disconnect: exp %p cookie "LPX64"\n",
00614                        exp, exp ? exp->exp_handle.h_cookie : -1);
00615                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00616         }
00617 
00618         cli = &obd->u.cli;
00619         imp = cli->cl_import;
00620 
00621         down_write(&cli->cl_sem);
00622         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "disconnect %s - %zu\n", obd->obd_name,
00623                 cli->cl_conn_count);
00624 
00625         if (cli->cl_conn_count == 0) {
00626                 CERROR("disconnecting disconnected device (%s)\n",
00627                        obd->obd_name);
00628                 GOTO(out_disconnect, rc = -EINVAL);
00629         }
00630 
00631         cli->cl_conn_count--;
00632         if (cli->cl_conn_count != 0)
00633                 GOTO(out_disconnect, rc = 0);
00634 
00635         /* Mark import deactivated now, so we don't try to reconnect if any
00636          * of the cleanup RPCs fails (e.g. LDLM cancel, etc).  We don't
00637          * fully deactivate the import, or that would drop all requests. */
00638         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00639         imp->imp_deactive = 1;
00640         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00641 
00642         /* Some non-replayable imports (MDS's OSCs) are pinged, so just
00643          * delete it regardless.  (It's safe to delete an import that was
00644          * never added.) */
00645         (void)ptlrpc_pinger_del_import(imp);
00646 
00647         if (obd->obd_namespace != NULL) {
00648                 /* obd_force == local only */
00649                 ldlm_cli_cancel_unused(obd->obd_namespace, NULL,
00650                                        obd->obd_force ? LCF_LOCAL : 0, NULL);
00651                 ldlm_namespace_free_prior(obd->obd_namespace, imp, obd->obd_force);
00652         }
00653 
00654         /* There's no need to hold sem while disconnecting an import,
00655          * and it may actually cause deadlock in GSS. */
00656         up_write(&cli->cl_sem);
00657         rc = ptlrpc_disconnect_import(imp, 0);
00658         down_write(&cli->cl_sem);
00659 
00660         ptlrpc_invalidate_import(imp);
00661 
00662         EXIT;
00663 
00664 out_disconnect:
00665         /* Use server style - class_disconnect should be always called for
00666          * o_disconnect. */
00667         err = class_disconnect(exp);
00668         if (!rc && err)
00669                 rc = err;
00670 
00671         up_write(&cli->cl_sem);
00672 
00673         RETURN(rc);
00674 }
00675 EXPORT_SYMBOL(client_disconnect_export);
00676 
00677 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
00678 int server_disconnect_export(struct obd_export *exp)
00679 {
00680         int rc;
00681         ENTRY;
00682 
00683         /* Disconnect early so that clients can't keep using export. */
00684         rc = class_disconnect(exp);
00685         /* Close import to avoid sending any requests. */
00686         if (exp->exp_imp_reverse)
00687                 ptlrpc_cleanup_imp(exp->exp_imp_reverse);
00688 
00689         ldlm_bl_thread_wakeup();
00690 
00691         /* complete all outstanding replies */
00692         spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
00693         while (!list_empty(&exp->exp_outstanding_replies)) {
00694                 struct ptlrpc_reply_state *rs =
00695                         list_entry(exp->exp_outstanding_replies.next,
00696                                        struct ptlrpc_reply_state, rs_exp_list);
00697                 struct ptlrpc_service_part *svcpt = rs->rs_svcpt;
00698 
00699                 spin_lock(&svcpt->scp_rep_lock);
00700 
00701                 list_del_init(&rs->rs_exp_list);
00702                 spin_lock(&rs->rs_lock);
00703                 ptlrpc_schedule_difficult_reply(rs);
00704                 spin_unlock(&rs->rs_lock);
00705 
00706                 spin_unlock(&svcpt->scp_rep_lock);
00707         }
00708         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
00709 
00710         RETURN(rc);
00711 }
00712 EXPORT_SYMBOL(server_disconnect_export);
00713 
00714 /* --------------------------------------------------------------------------
00715  * from old lib/target.c
00716  * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00717 
00718 static int target_handle_reconnect(struct lustre_handle *conn,
00719                                    struct obd_export *exp,
00720                                    struct obd_uuid *cluuid)
00721 {
00722         struct obd_device *target;
00723         struct lustre_handle *hdl;
00724         cfs_time_t now;
00725         cfs_time_t deadline;
00726         int timeout;
00727         int rc = 0;
00728         ENTRY;
00729 
00730         hdl = &exp->exp_imp_reverse->imp_remote_handle;
00731         if (!exp->exp_connection || !lustre_handle_is_used(hdl)) {
00732                 conn->cookie = exp->exp_handle.h_cookie;
00733                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "connect export for UUID '%s' at %p,"
00734                        " cookie "LPX64"\n", cluuid->uuid, exp, conn->cookie);
00735                 RETURN(0);
00736         }
00737 
00738         target = exp->exp_obd;
00739 
00740         /* Might be a re-connect after a partition. */
00741         if (memcmp(&conn->cookie, &hdl->cookie, sizeof conn->cookie)) {
00742                 LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: already connected client %s (at %s) "
00743                               "with handle "LPX64". Rejecting client "
00744                               "with the same UUID trying to reconnect "
00745                               "with handle "LPX64"\n", target->obd_name,
00746                               obd_uuid2str(&exp->exp_client_uuid),
00747                               obd_export_nid2str(exp),
00748                               hdl->cookie, conn->cookie);
00749                 memset(conn, 0, sizeof *conn);
00750                 /* target_handle_connect() treats EALREADY and
00751                  * -EALREADY differently.  -EALREADY is an error
00752                  * (same UUID, different handle). */
00753                 RETURN(-EALREADY);
00754         }
00755 
00756         if (!target->obd_recovering) {
00757                 LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: Client %s (at %s) reconnecting\n",
00758                         target->obd_name, obd_uuid2str(&exp->exp_client_uuid),
00759                         obd_export_nid2str(exp));
00760                 GOTO(out_already, rc);
00761         }
00762 
00763         now = cfs_time_current();
00764         deadline = cfs_timer_deadline(&target->obd_recovery_timer);
00765         if (cfs_time_before(now, deadline)) {
00766                 timeout = cfs_duration_sec(cfs_time_sub(deadline, now));
00767                 LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: Client %s (at %s) reconnecting,"
00768                         " waiting for %d clients in recovery for"
00769                         " %d:%.02d\n", target->obd_name,
00770                         obd_uuid2str(&exp->exp_client_uuid),
00771                         obd_export_nid2str(exp),
00772                         target->obd_max_recoverable_clients,
00773                         timeout / 60, timeout % 60);
00774         } else {
00775                 timeout = cfs_duration_sec(cfs_time_sub(now, deadline));
00776                 LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: Recovery already passed deadline"
00777                         " %d:%.02d, It is most likely due to DNE"
00778                         " recovery is failed or stuck, please wait a"
00779                         " few more minutes or abort the recovery.\n",
00780                         target->obd_name, timeout / 60, timeout % 60);
00781         }
00782 
00783 out_already:
00784         conn->cookie = exp->exp_handle.h_cookie;
00785         /* target_handle_connect() treats EALREADY and
00786          * -EALREADY differently.  EALREADY means we are
00787          * doing a valid reconnect from the same client. */
00788         RETURN(EALREADY);
00789 }
00790 
00791 void target_client_add_cb(struct obd_device *obd, __u64 transno, void *cb_data,
00792                           int error)
00793 {
00794         struct obd_export *exp = cb_data;
00795 
00796         CDEBUG(D_RPCTRACE, "%s: committing for initial connect of %s\n",
00797                obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid);
00798 
00799         spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
00800         exp->exp_need_sync = 0;
00801         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
00802         class_export_cb_put(exp);
00803 }
00804 
00805 static void
00806 check_and_start_recovery_timer(struct obd_device *obd,
00807                                struct ptlrpc_request *req, int new_client);
00808 
00812 static int rev_import_flags_update(struct obd_import *revimp,
00813                                    struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00814 {
00815         int rc;
00816         struct obd_connect_data *data;
00817 
00818         data = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_CONNECT_DATA);
00819 
00820         if (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_AT)
00821                 revimp->imp_msghdr_flags |= MSGHDR_AT_SUPPORT;
00822         else
00823                 revimp->imp_msghdr_flags &= ~MSGHDR_AT_SUPPORT;
00824 
00825         revimp->imp_msghdr_flags |= MSGHDR_CKSUM_INCOMPAT18;
00826 
00827         rc = sptlrpc_import_sec_adapt(revimp, req->rq_svc_ctx, &req->rq_flvr);
00828         if (rc) {
00829                 CERROR("%s: cannot get reverse import %s security: rc = %d\n",
00830                         revimp->imp_client->cli_name,
00831                         libcfs_id2str(req->rq_peer), rc);
00832                 return rc;
00833         }
00834 
00835         return 0;
00836 }
00837 
00844 int rev_import_init(struct obd_export *export)
00845 {
00846         struct obd_device *obd = export->exp_obd;
00847         struct obd_import *revimp;
00848 
00849         LASSERT(export->exp_imp_reverse == NULL);
00850 
00851         revimp = class_new_import(obd);
00852         if (revimp == NULL)
00853                 return -ENOMEM;
00854 
00855         revimp->imp_remote_handle.cookie = 0ULL;
00856         revimp->imp_client = &obd->obd_ldlm_client;
00857         revimp->imp_dlm_fake = 1;
00858 
00859         /* it is safe to connect import in new state as no sends possible */
00860         spin_lock(&export->exp_lock);
00861         export->exp_imp_reverse = revimp;
00862         spin_unlock(&export->exp_lock);
00863         class_import_put(revimp);
00864 
00865         return 0;
00866 }
00867 EXPORT_SYMBOL(rev_import_init);
00868 
00878 static int rev_import_reconnect(struct obd_export *exp,
00879                                 struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00880 {
00881         struct obd_import *revimp = exp->exp_imp_reverse;
00882         struct lustre_handle *lh;
00883         int rc;
00884 
00885         /* avoid sending a request until import flags are changed */
00886         ptlrpc_import_enter_resend(revimp);
00887 
00888         if (revimp->imp_connection != NULL)
00889                 ptlrpc_connection_put(revimp->imp_connection);
00890 
00891         /*
00892          * client from recovery don't have a handle so we need to take from
00893          * request. it may produce situation when wrong client connected
00894          * to recovery as we trust a client uuid
00895          */
00896         lh = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_CONN);
00897         revimp->imp_remote_handle = *lh;
00898 
00899         /* unknown versions will be caught in
00900          * ptlrpc_handle_server_req_in->lustre_unpack_msg() */
00901         revimp->imp_msg_magic = req->rq_reqmsg->lm_magic;
00902 
00903         revimp->imp_connection = ptlrpc_connection_addref(exp->exp_connection);
00904 
00905         rc = rev_import_flags_update(revimp, req);
00906         if (rc != 0) {
00907                 /* it is safe to still be in RECOVERY phase as we are not able
00908                  * to setup correct security flavor so requests are not able to
00909                  * be delivered correctly */
00910                 return rc;
00911         }
00912 
00913         /* resend all rpc's via new connection */
00914         return ptlrpc_import_recovery_state_machine(revimp);
00915 }
00916 
00917 int target_handle_connect(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00918 {
00919         struct obd_device *target = NULL;
00920         struct obd_export *export = NULL;
00921         /* connect handle - filled from target_handle_reconnect in
00922          * reconnect case */
00923         struct lustre_handle conn;
00924         struct lustre_handle *tmp;
00925         struct obd_uuid tgtuuid;
00926         struct obd_uuid cluuid;
00927         char *str;
00928         int rc = 0;
00929         char *target_start;
00930         int target_len;
00931         bool     mds_conn = false, lw_client = false;
00932         bool     mds_mds_conn = false;
00933         bool     new_mds_mds_conn = false;
00934         bool     target_referenced = false;
00935         struct obd_connect_data *data, *tmpdata;
00936         int size, tmpsize;
00937         lnet_nid_t *client_nid = NULL;
00938         ENTRY;
00939 
00940         OBD_RACE(OBD_FAIL_TGT_CONN_RACE);
00941 
00942         str = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_TGTUUID);
00943         if (str == NULL) {
00944                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "bad target UUID for connect");
00945                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00946         }
00947 
00948         obd_str2uuid(&tgtuuid, str);
00949         target = class_uuid2obd(&tgtuuid);
00950         if (!target)
00951                 target = class_name2obd(str);
00952 
00953         if (!target) {
00954                 deuuidify(str, NULL, &target_start, &target_len);
00955                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x137, "%s: not available for connect "
00956                                    "from %s (no target). If you are running "
00957                                    "an HA pair check that the target is "
00958                                    "mounted on the other server.\n", str,
00959                                    libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid));
00960                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENODEV);
00961         }
00962 
00963         spin_lock(&target->obd_dev_lock);
00964         if (target->obd_stopping || !target->obd_set_up) {
00965                 spin_unlock(&target->obd_dev_lock);
00966 
00967                 deuuidify(str, NULL, &target_start, &target_len);
00968                 LCONSOLE_INFO("%.*s: Not available for connect from %s (%s)\n",
00969                               target_len, target_start,
00970                               libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid),
00971                               (target->obd_stopping ?
00972                                "stopping" : "not set up"));
00973                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENODEV);
00974         }
00975 
00976         if (target->obd_no_conn) {
00977                 spin_unlock(&target->obd_dev_lock);
00978 
00979                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: Temporarily refusing client connection "
00980                                "from %s\n", target->obd_name,
00981                                libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid));
00982                 GOTO(out, rc = -EAGAIN);
00983         }
00984 
00985         /* Make sure the target isn't cleaned up while we're here. Yes,
00986          * there's still a race between the above check and our incref here.
00987          * Really, class_uuid2obd should take the ref. */
00988         class_incref(target, __func__, current);
00989         target_referenced = true;
00990 
00991         target->obd_conn_inprogress++;
00992         spin_unlock(&target->obd_dev_lock);
00993 
00994         str = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_CLUUID);
00995         if (str == NULL) {
00996                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "bad client UUID for connect");
00997                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00998         }
00999 
01000         obd_str2uuid(&cluuid, str);
01001 
01002         tmp = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_CONN);
01003         if (tmp == NULL)
01004                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01005 
01006         conn = *tmp;
01007 
01008         size = req_capsule_get_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_CONNECT_DATA,
01009                                     RCL_CLIENT);
01010         data = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_CONNECT_DATA);
01011         if (!data)
01012                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01013 
01014         rc = req_capsule_server_pack(&req->rq_pill);
01015         if (rc)
01016                 GOTO(out, rc);
01017 
01018 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE < OBD_OCD_VERSION(3, 0, 53, 0)
01019         /* Don't allow clients to connect that are using old 1.8 format
01020          * protocol conventions (LUSTRE_MSG_MAGIC_v1, !MSGHDR_CKSUM_INCOMPAT18,
01021          * ldlm_flock_policy_wire format, MDT_ATTR_xTIME_SET, etc).  The
01022          * FULL20 flag should be set on all connections since 2.0, but no
01023          * longer affects behaviour.
01024          *
01025          * Later this check will be disabled and the flag can be retired
01026          * completely once interop with 3.0 is no longer needed.
01027          */
01028         if (!(data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_FULL20))
01029                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01030 #endif
01031 
01032         if (lustre_msg_get_op_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSG_CONNECT_LIBCLIENT) {
01033                 if (data->ocd_version < LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE -
01034                                                LUSTRE_VERSION_ALLOWED_OFFSET ||
01035                     data->ocd_version > LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE +
01036                                                LUSTRE_VERSION_ALLOWED_OFFSET) {
01037                         DEBUG_REQ(D_WARNING, req, "Refusing %s (%d.%d.%d.%d) "
01038                                   "libclient connection attempt",
01039                                   data->ocd_version < LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE ?
01040                                   "old" : "new",
01041                                   OBD_OCD_VERSION_MAJOR(data->ocd_version),
01042                                   OBD_OCD_VERSION_MINOR(data->ocd_version),
01043                                   OBD_OCD_VERSION_PATCH(data->ocd_version),
01044                                   OBD_OCD_VERSION_FIX(data->ocd_version));
01045                         data = req_capsule_server_sized_get(&req->rq_pill,
01046                                                             &RMF_CONNECT_DATA,
01047                                     offsetof(typeof(*data), ocd_version) +
01048                                              sizeof(data->ocd_version));
01049                         if (data) {
01050                                 data->ocd_connect_flags = OBD_CONNECT_VERSION;
01051                                 data->ocd_version = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
01052                         }
01053                         GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01054                 }
01055         }
01056 
01057         /* Note: lw_client is needed in MDS-MDS failover during update log
01058          * processing, so we needs to allow lw_client to be connected at
01059          * anytime, instead of only the initial connection */
01060         lw_client = (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_LIGHTWEIGHT) != 0;
01061 
01062         if (lustre_msg_get_op_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSG_CONNECT_INITIAL) {
01063                 mds_conn = (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_MDS) != 0;
01064                 mds_mds_conn = (data->ocd_connect_flags &
01065                                 OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS) != 0;
01066 
01067                 /* OBD_CONNECT_MNE_SWAB is defined as OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS
01068                  * for Imperative Recovery connection from MGC to MGS.
01069                  *
01070                  * Via check OBD_CONNECT_FID, we can distinguish whether
01071                  * the OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS/OBD_CONNECT_MNE_SWAB is from
01072                  * MGC or MDT. */
01073                 if (!lw_client &&
01074                     (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS) &&
01075                     (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_FID) &&
01076                     (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_VERSION)) {
01077                         __u32 major = OBD_OCD_VERSION_MAJOR(data->ocd_version);
01078                         __u32 minor = OBD_OCD_VERSION_MINOR(data->ocd_version);
01079                         __u32 patch = OBD_OCD_VERSION_PATCH(data->ocd_version);
01080 
01081                         /* We do not support the MDT-MDT interoperations with
01082                          * different version MDT because of protocol changes. */
01083                         if (unlikely(major != LUSTRE_MAJOR ||
01084                                      minor != LUSTRE_MINOR ||
01085                                      abs(patch - LUSTRE_PATCH) > 3)) {
01086                                 LCONSOLE_WARN("%s (%u.%u.%u.%u) refused the "
01087                                         "connection from different version MDT "
01088                                         "(%d.%d.%d.%d) %s %s\n",
01089                                         target->obd_name, LUSTRE_MAJOR,
01090                                         LUSTRE_MINOR, LUSTRE_PATCH, LUSTRE_FIX,
01091                                         major, minor, patch,
01092                                         OBD_OCD_VERSION_FIX(data->ocd_version),
01093                                         libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid), str);
01094 
01095                                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01096                         }
01097                 }
01098         }
01099 
01100         /* lctl gets a backstage, all-access pass. */
01101         if (obd_uuid_equals(&cluuid, &target->obd_uuid))
01102                 goto dont_check_exports;
01103 
01104         export = cfs_hash_lookup(target->obd_uuid_hash, &cluuid);
01105         if (!export)
01106                 goto no_export;
01107 
01108         /* We've found an export in the hash. */
01109 
01110         spin_lock(&export->exp_lock);
01111 
01112         if (export->exp_connecting) { /* bug 9635, et. al. */
01113                 spin_unlock(&export->exp_lock);
01114                 LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: Export %p already connecting from %s\n",
01115                               export->exp_obd->obd_name, export,
01116                               libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid));
01117                 class_export_put(export);
01118                 export = NULL;
01119                 rc = -EALREADY;
01120         } else if ((mds_conn || lw_client) && export->exp_connection != NULL) {
01121                 spin_unlock(&export->exp_lock);
01122                 if (req->rq_peer.nid != export->exp_connection->c_peer.nid)
01123                         /* MDS or LWP reconnected after failover. */
01124                         LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: Received %s connection from "
01125                             "%s, removing former export from %s\n",
01126                             target->obd_name, mds_conn ? "MDS" : "LWP",
01127                             libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid),
01128                             libcfs_nid2str(export->exp_connection->c_peer.nid));
01129                 else
01130                         /* New MDS connection from the same NID. */
01131                         LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: Received new %s connection from "
01132                                 "%s, removing former export from same NID\n",
01133                                 target->obd_name, mds_conn ? "MDS" : "LWP",
01134                                 libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid));
01135                 class_fail_export(export);
01136                 class_export_put(export);
01137                 export = NULL;
01138                 rc = 0;
01139         } else if (export->exp_connection != NULL &&
01140                    req->rq_peer.nid != export->exp_connection->c_peer.nid &&
01141                    (lustre_msg_get_op_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) &
01142                     MSG_CONNECT_INITIAL)) {
01143                 spin_unlock(&export->exp_lock);
01144                 /* In MDS failover we have static UUID but NID can change. */
01145                 LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: Client %s seen on new nid %s when "
01146                               "existing nid %s is already connected\n",
01147                               target->obd_name, cluuid.uuid,
01148                               libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid),
01149                               libcfs_nid2str(
01150                                       export->exp_connection->c_peer.nid));
01151                 rc = -EALREADY;
01152                 class_export_put(export);
01153                 export = NULL;
01154         } else {
01155                 export->exp_connecting = 1;
01156                 spin_unlock(&export->exp_lock);
01157                 LASSERT(export->exp_obd == target);
01158 
01159                 rc = target_handle_reconnect(&conn, export, &cluuid);
01160         }
01161 
01162         /* If we found an export, we already unlocked. */
01163         if (!export) {
01164 no_export:
01165                 OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_TGT_DELAY_CONNECT, 2 * obd_timeout);
01166         } else if (req->rq_export == NULL &&
01167                    atomic_read(&export->exp_rpc_count) > 0) {
01168                 LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: Client %s (at %s) refused connection, "
01169                               "still busy with %d references\n",
01170                               target->obd_name, cluuid.uuid,
01171                               libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid),
01172                               atomic_read(&export->exp_refcount));
01173                 GOTO(out, rc = -EBUSY);
01174         } else if (lustre_msg_get_conn_cnt(req->rq_reqmsg) == 1) {
01175                 if (!strstr(cluuid.uuid, "mdt"))
01176                         LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: Rejecting reconnect from the "
01177                                       "known client %s (at %s) because it "
01178                                       "is indicating it is a new client",
01179                                       target->obd_name, cluuid.uuid,
01180                                       libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid));
01181                 GOTO(out, rc = -EALREADY);
01182         } else {
01183                 OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_TGT_DELAY_RECONNECT, 2 * obd_timeout);
01184         }
01185 
01186         if (rc < 0) {
01187                 GOTO(out, rc);
01188         }
01189 
01190         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: connection from %s@%s %st"LPU64" exp %p cur %ld last %ld\n",
01191                target->obd_name, cluuid.uuid, libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid),
01192               target->obd_recovering ? "recovering/" : "", data->ocd_transno,
01193               export, (long)cfs_time_current_sec(),
01194               export ? (long)export->exp_last_request_time : 0);
01195 
01196         /* If this is the first time a client connects, reset the recovery
01197          * timer. Discard lightweight connections which might be local. */
01198         if (!lw_client && rc == 0 && target->obd_recovering)
01199                 check_and_start_recovery_timer(target, req, export == NULL);
01200 
01201         /* We want to handle EALREADY but *not* -EALREADY from
01202          * target_handle_reconnect(), return reconnection state in a flag. */
01203         if (rc == EALREADY) {
01204                 lustre_msg_add_op_flags(req->rq_repmsg, MSG_CONNECT_RECONNECT);
01205                 rc = 0;
01206         } else {
01207                 LASSERT(rc == 0);
01208         }
01209 
01210         /* Tell the client if we support replayable requests. */
01211         if (target->obd_replayable)
01212                 lustre_msg_add_op_flags(req->rq_repmsg, MSG_CONNECT_REPLAYABLE);
01213         client_nid = &req->rq_peer.nid;
01214 
01215         if (export == NULL) {
01216                 /* allow lightweight connections during recovery */
01217                 /* allow "new" MDT to be connected during recovery, since we
01218                  * need retrieve recovery update records from it */
01219                 if (target->obd_recovering && !lw_client && !mds_mds_conn) {
01220                         cfs_time_t t;
01221                         int     c; /* connected */
01222                         int     i; /* in progress */
01223                         int     k; /* known */
01224                         int     s; /* stale/evicted */
01225 
01226                         c = atomic_read(&target->obd_connected_clients);
01227                         i = atomic_read(&target->obd_lock_replay_clients);
01228                         k = target->obd_max_recoverable_clients;
01229                         s = target->obd_stale_clients;
01230                         t = cfs_timer_deadline(&target->obd_recovery_timer);
01231                         t = cfs_time_sub(t, cfs_time_current());
01232                         t = cfs_duration_sec(t);
01233                         LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: Denying connection for new client %s"
01234                                       "(at %s), waiting for %d known clients "
01235                                       "(%d recovered, %d in progress, and %d "
01236                                       "evicted) to recover in %d:%.02d\n",
01237                                       target->obd_name, cluuid.uuid,
01238                                       libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid), k,
01239                                       c - i, i, s, (int)t / 60,
01240                                       (int)t % 60);
01241                         rc = -EBUSY;
01242                 } else {
01243 dont_check_exports:
01244                         rc = obd_connect(req->rq_svc_thread->t_env,
01245                                          &export, target, &cluuid, data,
01246                                          client_nid);
01247                         if (mds_conn && OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_TGT_RCVG_FLAG))
01248                                 lustre_msg_add_op_flags(req->rq_repmsg,
01249                                                         MSG_CONNECT_RECOVERING);
01250                         if (rc == 0) {
01251                                 conn.cookie = export->exp_handle.h_cookie;
01252                                 rc = rev_import_init(export);
01253                         }
01254 
01255                         if (mds_mds_conn)
01256                                 new_mds_mds_conn = true;
01257                 }
01258         } else {
01259                 rc = obd_reconnect(req->rq_svc_thread->t_env,
01260                                    export, target, &cluuid, data, client_nid);
01261         }
01262         if (rc)
01263                 GOTO(out, rc);
01264 
01265         LASSERT(target->u.obt.obt_magic == OBT_MAGIC);
01266         data->ocd_instance = target->u.obt.obt_instance;
01267 
01268         /* Return only the parts of obd_connect_data that we understand, so the
01269          * client knows that we don't understand the rest. */
01270         if (data) {
01271                 tmpsize = req_capsule_get_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_CONNECT_DATA,
01272                                                RCL_SERVER);
01273                 tmpdata = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill,
01274                                                  &RMF_CONNECT_DATA);
01275                 /* Don't use struct assignment here, because the client reply
01276                  * buffer may be smaller/larger than the local struct
01277                  * obd_connect_data. */
01278                 memcpy(tmpdata, data, min(tmpsize, size));
01279         }
01280 
01281         /* If the client and the server are the same node, we will already
01282          * have an export that really points to the client's DLM export,
01283          * because we have a shared handles table.
01284          *
01285          * XXX this will go away when shaver stops sending the "connect" handle
01286          * in the real "remote handle" field of the request --phik 24 Apr 2003
01287          */
01288         ptlrpc_request_change_export(req, export);
01289 
01290         spin_lock(&export->exp_lock);
01291         if (export->exp_conn_cnt >= lustre_msg_get_conn_cnt(req->rq_reqmsg)) {
01292                 spin_unlock(&export->exp_lock);
01293                 CDEBUG(D_RPCTRACE, "%s: %s already connected at greater "
01294                        "or equal conn_cnt: %d >= %d\n",
01295                        cluuid.uuid, libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid),
01296                        export->exp_conn_cnt,
01297                        lustre_msg_get_conn_cnt(req->rq_reqmsg));
01298 
01299                 GOTO(out, rc = -EALREADY);
01300         }
01301         LASSERT(lustre_msg_get_conn_cnt(req->rq_reqmsg) > 0);
01302         export->exp_conn_cnt = lustre_msg_get_conn_cnt(req->rq_reqmsg);
01303 
01304         /* Don't evict liblustre clients for not pinging. */
01305         if (lustre_msg_get_op_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSG_CONNECT_LIBCLIENT) {
01306                 export->exp_libclient = 1;
01307                 spin_unlock(&export->exp_lock);
01308 
01309                 spin_lock(&target->obd_dev_lock);
01310                 list_del_init(&export->exp_obd_chain_timed);
01311                 spin_unlock(&target->obd_dev_lock);
01312         } else {
01313                 spin_unlock(&export->exp_lock);
01314         }
01315 
01316         if (export->exp_connection != NULL) {
01317                 /* Check to see if connection came from another NID. */
01318                 if ((export->exp_connection->c_peer.nid != req->rq_peer.nid) &&
01319                     !hlist_unhashed(&export->exp_nid_hash))
01320                         cfs_hash_del(export->exp_obd->obd_nid_hash,
01321                                      &export->exp_connection->c_peer.nid,
01322                                      &export->exp_nid_hash);
01323 
01324                 ptlrpc_connection_put(export->exp_connection);
01325         }
01326 
01327         export->exp_connection = ptlrpc_connection_get(req->rq_peer,
01328                                                        req->rq_self,
01329                                                        &cluuid);
01330         if (hlist_unhashed(&export->exp_nid_hash))
01331                 cfs_hash_add(export->exp_obd->obd_nid_hash,
01332                              &export->exp_connection->c_peer.nid,
01333                              &export->exp_nid_hash);
01334 
01335         lustre_msg_set_handle(req->rq_repmsg, &conn);
01336 
01337         rc = rev_import_reconnect(export, req);
01338         if (rc != 0)
01339                 GOTO(out, rc);
01340 
01341         if (target->obd_recovering && !export->exp_in_recovery && !lw_client) {
01342                 int has_transno;
01343                 __u64 transno = data->ocd_transno;
01344 
01345                 spin_lock(&export->exp_lock);
01346                 /* possible race with class_disconnect_stale_exports,
01347                  * export may be already in the eviction process */
01348                 if (export->exp_failed) {
01349                         spin_unlock(&export->exp_lock);
01350                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENODEV);
01351                 }
01352                 export->exp_in_recovery = 1;
01353                 export->exp_req_replay_needed = 1;
01354                 export->exp_lock_replay_needed = 1;
01355                 spin_unlock(&export->exp_lock);
01356 
01357                 has_transno = !!(lustre_msg_get_op_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) &
01358                                  MSG_CONNECT_TRANSNO);
01359                 if (has_transno && transno == 0)
01360                         CWARN("Connect with zero transno!\n");
01361 
01362                 if (has_transno && transno > 0 &&
01363                     transno < target->obd_next_recovery_transno &&
01364                     transno > target->obd_last_committed) {
01365                         /* Another way is to use cmpxchg() to be lock-free. */
01366                         spin_lock(&target->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01367                         if (transno < target->obd_next_recovery_transno)
01368                                 target->obd_next_recovery_transno = transno;
01369                         spin_unlock(&target->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01370                 }
01371 
01372                 atomic_inc(&target->obd_req_replay_clients);
01373                 atomic_inc(&target->obd_lock_replay_clients);
01374                 /* Note: MDS-MDS connection is allowed to be connected during
01375                  * recovery, no matter if the exports needs to be recoveried.
01376                  * Because we need retrieve updates logs from all other MDTs.
01377                  * So if the MDS-MDS export is new, obd_max_recoverable_clients
01378                  * also needs to be increased to match other recovery checking
01379                  * condition. */
01380                 if (new_mds_mds_conn)
01381                         target->obd_max_recoverable_clients++;
01382                 if (atomic_inc_return(&target->obd_connected_clients) ==
01383                     target->obd_max_recoverable_clients)
01384                         wake_up(&target->obd_next_transno_waitq);
01385         }
01386 
01387         /* Tell the client we're in recovery, when client is involved in it. */
01388         if (target->obd_recovering && !lw_client)
01389                 lustre_msg_add_op_flags(req->rq_repmsg, MSG_CONNECT_RECOVERING);
01390 
01391 out:
01392         if (export) {
01393                 spin_lock(&export->exp_lock);
01394                 export->exp_connecting = 0;
01395                 spin_unlock(&export->exp_lock);
01396 
01397                 class_export_put(export);
01398         }
01399         if (target_referenced == true && target != NULL) {
01400                 spin_lock(&target->obd_dev_lock);
01401                 target->obd_conn_inprogress--;
01402                 spin_unlock(&target->obd_dev_lock);
01403 
01404                 class_decref(target, __func__, current);
01405         }
01406         req->rq_status = rc;
01407         RETURN(rc);
01408 }
01409 
01410 int target_handle_disconnect(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
01411 {
01412         int rc;
01413         ENTRY;
01414 
01415         rc = req_capsule_server_pack(&req->rq_pill);
01416         if (rc)
01417                 RETURN(rc);
01418 
01419         /* Keep the rq_export around so we can send the reply. */
01420         req->rq_status = obd_disconnect(class_export_get(req->rq_export));
01421 
01422         RETURN(0);
01423 }
01424 
01425 void target_destroy_export(struct obd_export *exp)
01426 {
01427         struct obd_import       *imp = NULL;
01428         /* exports created from last_rcvd data, and "fake"
01429            exports created by lctl don't have an import */
01430         spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
01431         if (exp->exp_imp_reverse != NULL) {
01432                 imp = exp->exp_imp_reverse;
01433                 exp->exp_imp_reverse = NULL;
01434         }
01435         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
01436         if (imp != NULL)
01437                 client_destroy_import(imp);
01438 
01439         LASSERT_ATOMIC_ZERO(&exp->exp_locks_count);
01440         LASSERT_ATOMIC_ZERO(&exp->exp_rpc_count);
01441         LASSERT_ATOMIC_ZERO(&exp->exp_cb_count);
01442         LASSERT_ATOMIC_ZERO(&exp->exp_replay_count);
01443 }
01444 EXPORT_SYMBOL(target_destroy_export);
01445 
01446 /*
01447  * Recovery functions
01448  */
01449 static void target_request_copy_get(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
01450 {
01451         class_export_rpc_inc(req->rq_export);
01452         LASSERT(list_empty(&req->rq_list));
01453         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&req->rq_replay_list);
01454 
01455         /* Increase refcount to keep request in queue. */
01456         atomic_inc(&req->rq_refcount);
01457         /* Let export know it has replays to be handled. */
01458         atomic_inc(&req->rq_export->exp_replay_count);
01459 }
01460 
01461 static void target_request_copy_put(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
01462 {
01463         LASSERT(list_empty(&req->rq_replay_list));
01464         LASSERT_ATOMIC_POS(&req->rq_export->exp_replay_count);
01465 
01466         atomic_dec(&req->rq_export->exp_replay_count);
01467         class_export_rpc_dec(req->rq_export);
01468         ptlrpc_server_drop_request(req);
01469 }
01470 
01471 static int target_exp_enqueue_req_replay(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
01472 {
01473         __u64                  transno = lustre_msg_get_transno(req->rq_reqmsg);
01474         struct obd_export     *exp = req->rq_export;
01475         struct ptlrpc_request *reqiter;
01476         struct ptlrpc_request *dup_req = NULL;
01477         int                    dup = 0;
01478 
01479         LASSERT(exp);
01480 
01481         spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
01482         list_for_each_entry(reqiter, &exp->exp_req_replay_queue,
01483                                 rq_replay_list) {
01484                 if (lustre_msg_get_transno(reqiter->rq_reqmsg) == transno) {
01485                         dup_req = reqiter;
01486                         dup = 1;
01487                         break;
01488                 }
01489         }
01490 
01491         if (dup) {
01492                 /* We expect it with RESENT and REPLAY flags. */
01493                 if ((lustre_msg_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) &
01494                      (MSG_RESENT | MSG_REPLAY)) != (MSG_RESENT | MSG_REPLAY))
01495                         CERROR("invalid flags %x of resent replay\n",
01496                                lustre_msg_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg));
01497 
01498                 if (lustre_msg_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSG_REPLAY) {
01499                         __u32 new_conn;
01500 
01501                         new_conn = lustre_msg_get_conn_cnt(req->rq_reqmsg);
01502                         if (new_conn >
01503                             lustre_msg_get_conn_cnt(dup_req->rq_reqmsg))
01504                                 lustre_msg_set_conn_cnt(dup_req->rq_reqmsg,
01505                                                         new_conn);
01506                 }
01507         } else {
01508                 list_add_tail(&req->rq_replay_list,
01509                                   &exp->exp_req_replay_queue);
01510         }
01511 
01512         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
01513         return dup;
01514 }
01515 
01516 static void target_exp_dequeue_req_replay(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
01517 {
01518         LASSERT(!list_empty(&req->rq_replay_list));
01519         LASSERT(req->rq_export);
01520 
01521         spin_lock(&req->rq_export->exp_lock);
01522         list_del_init(&req->rq_replay_list);
01523         spin_unlock(&req->rq_export->exp_lock);
01524 }
01525 
01526 static void target_finish_recovery(struct lu_target *lut)
01527 {
01528         struct obd_device *obd = lut->lut_obd;
01529         ENTRY;
01530 
01531         /* Only log a recovery message when recovery has occurred. */
01532         if (obd->obd_recovery_start) {
01533                 time_t elapsed_time = max_t(time_t, 1, cfs_time_current_sec() -
01534                                         obd->obd_recovery_start);
01535                 LCONSOLE_INFO("%s: Recovery over after %d:%.02d, of %d clients "
01536                         "%d recovered and %d %s evicted.\n", obd->obd_name,
01537                         (int)elapsed_time / 60, (int)elapsed_time % 60,
01538                         obd->obd_max_recoverable_clients,
01539                         atomic_read(&obd->obd_connected_clients),
01540                         obd->obd_stale_clients,
01541                         obd->obd_stale_clients == 1 ? "was" : "were");
01542         }
01543 
01544         ldlm_reprocess_all_ns(obd->obd_namespace);
01545         spin_lock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01546         if (!list_empty(&obd->obd_req_replay_queue) ||
01547             !list_empty(&obd->obd_lock_replay_queue) ||
01548             !list_empty(&obd->obd_final_req_queue)) {
01549                 CERROR("%s: Recovery queues ( %s%s%s) are not empty\n",
01550                        obd->obd_name,
01551                        list_empty(&obd->obd_req_replay_queue) ? "" : "req ",
01552                        list_empty(&obd->obd_lock_replay_queue) ? \
01553                                "" : "lock ",
01554                        list_empty(&obd->obd_final_req_queue) ? \
01555                                "" : "final ");
01556                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01557                 LBUG();
01558         }
01559         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01560 
01561         obd->obd_recovery_end = cfs_time_current_sec();
01562 
01563         /* When recovery finished, cleanup orphans on MDS and OST. */
01564         if (OBT(obd) && OBP(obd, postrecov)) {
01565                 int rc = OBP(obd, postrecov)(obd);
01566                 if (rc < 0)
01567                         LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: Post recovery failed, rc %d\n",
01568                                       obd->obd_name, rc);
01569         }
01570         EXIT;
01571 }
01572 
01573 static void abort_req_replay_queue(struct obd_device *obd)
01574 {
01575         struct ptlrpc_request *req, *n;
01576         struct list_head abort_list;
01577 
01578         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&abort_list);
01579         spin_lock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01580         list_splice_init(&obd->obd_req_replay_queue, &abort_list);
01581         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01582         list_for_each_entry_safe(req, n, &abort_list, rq_list) {
01583                 DEBUG_REQ(D_WARNING, req, "aborted:");
01584                 req->rq_status = -ENOTCONN;
01585                 if (ptlrpc_error(req)) {
01586                         DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req,
01587                                   "failed abort_req_reply; skipping");
01588                 }
01589                 target_exp_dequeue_req_replay(req);
01590                 target_request_copy_put(req);
01591         }
01592 }
01593 
01594 static void abort_lock_replay_queue(struct obd_device *obd)
01595 {
01596         struct ptlrpc_request *req, *n;
01597         struct list_head abort_list;
01598 
01599         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&abort_list);
01600         spin_lock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01601         list_splice_init(&obd->obd_lock_replay_queue, &abort_list);
01602         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01603         list_for_each_entry_safe(req, n, &abort_list, rq_list) {
01604                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "aborted:");
01605                 req->rq_status = -ENOTCONN;
01606                 if (ptlrpc_error(req)) {
01607                         DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req,
01608                                   "failed abort_lock_reply; skipping");
01609                 }
01610                 target_request_copy_put(req);
01611         }
01612 }
01613 
01614 /* Called from a cleanup function if the device is being cleaned up
01615    forcefully.  The exports should all have been disconnected already,
01616    the only thing left to do is
01617      - clear the recovery flags
01618      - cancel the timer
01619      - free queued requests and replies, but don't send replies
01620    Because the obd_stopping flag is set, no new requests should be received.
01621 
01622 */
01623 void target_cleanup_recovery(struct obd_device *obd)
01624 {
01625         struct ptlrpc_request *req, *n;
01626         struct list_head clean_list;
01627 
01628         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&clean_list);
01629         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01630         if (!obd->obd_recovering) {
01631                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01632                 EXIT;
01633                 return;
01634         }
01635         obd->obd_recovering = obd->obd_abort_recovery = 0;
01636         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01637 
01638         spin_lock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01639         target_cancel_recovery_timer(obd);
01640         list_splice_init(&obd->obd_req_replay_queue, &clean_list);
01641         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01642 
01643         list_for_each_entry_safe(req, n, &clean_list, rq_list) {
01644                 LASSERT(req->rq_reply_state == NULL);
01645                 target_exp_dequeue_req_replay(req);
01646                 target_request_copy_put(req);
01647         }
01648 
01649         spin_lock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01650         list_splice_init(&obd->obd_lock_replay_queue, &clean_list);
01651         list_splice_init(&obd->obd_final_req_queue, &clean_list);
01652         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01653 
01654         list_for_each_entry_safe(req, n, &clean_list, rq_list) {
01655                 LASSERT(req->rq_reply_state == NULL);
01656                 target_request_copy_put(req);
01657         }
01658 
01659         EXIT;
01660 }
01661 EXPORT_SYMBOL(target_cleanup_recovery);
01662 
01663 /* obd_recovery_task_lock should be held */
01664 void target_cancel_recovery_timer(struct obd_device *obd)
01665 {
01666         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: cancel recovery timer\n", obd->obd_name);
01667         cfs_timer_disarm(&obd->obd_recovery_timer);
01668 }
01669 
01670 static void target_start_recovery_timer(struct obd_device *obd)
01671 {
01672         if (obd->obd_recovery_start != 0)
01673                 return;
01674 
01675         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01676         if (!obd->obd_recovering || obd->obd_abort_recovery) {
01677                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01678                 return;
01679         }
01680 
01681         LASSERT(obd->obd_recovery_timeout != 0);
01682 
01683         if (obd->obd_recovery_start != 0) {
01684                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01685                 return;
01686         }
01687 
01688         cfs_timer_arm(&obd->obd_recovery_timer,
01689                       cfs_time_shift(obd->obd_recovery_timeout));
01690         obd->obd_recovery_start = cfs_time_current_sec();
01691         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01692 
01693         LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: Will be in recovery for at least %d:%.02d, "
01694                       "or until %d client%s reconnect%s\n",
01695                       obd->obd_name,
01696                       obd->obd_recovery_timeout / 60,
01697                       obd->obd_recovery_timeout % 60,
01698                       obd->obd_max_recoverable_clients,
01699                       (obd->obd_max_recoverable_clients == 1) ? "" : "s",
01700                       (obd->obd_max_recoverable_clients == 1) ? "s": "");
01701 }
01702 
01709 static void extend_recovery_timer(struct obd_device *obd, int drt, bool extend)
01710 {
01711         cfs_time_t now;
01712         cfs_time_t end;
01713         cfs_duration_t left;
01714         int to;
01715 
01716         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01717         if (!obd->obd_recovering || obd->obd_abort_recovery) {
01718                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01719                 return;
01720         }
01721         LASSERT(obd->obd_recovery_start != 0);
01722 
01723         now  = cfs_time_current_sec();
01724         to   = obd->obd_recovery_timeout;
01725         end  = obd->obd_recovery_start + to;
01726         left = cfs_time_sub(end, now);
01727 
01728         if (extend && (drt > left)) {
01729                 to += drt - left;
01730         } else if (!extend && (drt > to)) {
01731                 to = drt;
01732         }
01733 
01734         if (to > obd->obd_recovery_time_hard)
01735                 to = obd->obd_recovery_time_hard;
01736         if (obd->obd_recovery_timeout < to) {
01737                 obd->obd_recovery_timeout = to;
01738                 end = obd->obd_recovery_start + to;
01739                 cfs_timer_arm(&obd->obd_recovery_timer,
01740                                 cfs_time_shift(end - now));
01741         }
01742         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01743 
01744         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: recovery timer will expire in %u seconds\n",
01745                 obd->obd_name, (unsigned)cfs_time_sub(end, now));
01746 }
01747 
01748 /* Reset the timer with each new client connection */
01749 /*
01750  * This timer is actually reconnect_timer, which is for making sure
01751  * the total recovery window is at least as big as my reconnect
01752  * attempt timing. So the initial recovery time_out will be set to
01753  * OBD_RECOVERY_FACTOR * obd_timeout. If the timeout coming
01754  * from client is bigger than this, then the recovery time_out will
01755  * be extended to make sure the client could be reconnected, in the
01756  * process, the timeout from the new client should be ignored.
01757  */
01758 
01759 static void
01760 check_and_start_recovery_timer(struct obd_device *obd,
01761                                struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01762                                int new_client)
01763 {
01764         int service_time = lustre_msg_get_service_time(req->rq_reqmsg);
01765         struct obd_device_target *obt = &obd->u.obt;
01766 
01767         if (!new_client && service_time)
01768                 /* Teach server about old server's estimates, as first guess
01769                  * at how long new requests will take. */
01770                 at_measured(&req->rq_rqbd->rqbd_svcpt->scp_at_estimate,
01771                             service_time);
01772 
01773         target_start_recovery_timer(obd);
01774 
01775         /* Convert the service time to RPC timeout,
01776          * and reuse service_time to limit stack usage. */
01777         service_time = at_est2timeout(service_time);
01778 
01779         /* We expect other clients to timeout within service_time, then try
01780          * to reconnect, then try the failover server.  The max delay between
01781          * connect attempts is SWITCH_MAX + SWITCH_INC + INITIAL. */
01782         service_time += 2 * INITIAL_CONNECT_TIMEOUT;
01783 
01784         LASSERT(obt->obt_magic == OBT_MAGIC);
01785         service_time += 2 * (CONNECTION_SWITCH_MAX + CONNECTION_SWITCH_INC);
01786         if (service_time > obd->obd_recovery_timeout && !new_client)
01787                 extend_recovery_timer(obd, service_time, false);
01788 }
01789 
01791 static inline int exp_connect_healthy(struct obd_export *exp)
01792 {
01793         return (exp->exp_in_recovery);
01794 }
01795 
01797 static inline int exp_req_replay_healthy(struct obd_export *exp)
01798 {
01799         return (!exp->exp_req_replay_needed ||
01800                 atomic_read(&exp->exp_replay_count) > 0);
01801 }
01802 
01803 
01804 static inline int exp_req_replay_healthy_or_from_mdt(struct obd_export *exp)
01805 {
01806         return (exp_connect_flags(exp) & OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS) ||
01807                exp_req_replay_healthy(exp);
01808 }
01809 
01811 static inline int exp_lock_replay_healthy(struct obd_export *exp)
01812 {
01813         return (!exp->exp_lock_replay_needed ||
01814                 atomic_read(&exp->exp_replay_count) > 0);
01815 }
01816 
01817 static inline int exp_vbr_healthy(struct obd_export *exp)
01818 {
01819         return (!exp->exp_vbr_failed);
01820 }
01821 
01822 static inline int exp_finished(struct obd_export *exp)
01823 {
01824         return (exp->exp_in_recovery && !exp->exp_lock_replay_needed);
01825 }
01826 
01827 static inline int exp_finished_or_from_mdt(struct obd_export *exp)
01828 {
01829         return (exp_connect_flags(exp) & OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS) ||
01830                 exp_finished(exp);
01831 }
01832 
01833 static int check_for_next_transno(struct lu_target *lut)
01834 {
01835         struct ptlrpc_request *req = NULL;
01836         struct obd_device *obd = lut->lut_obd;
01837         struct target_distribute_txn_data *tdtd = lut->lut_tdtd;
01838         int wake_up = 0, connected, completed, queue_len;
01839         __u64 req_transno = 0;
01840         __u64 update_transno = 0;
01841         __u64 next_transno = 0;
01842         ENTRY;
01843 
01844         spin_lock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01845         if (!list_empty(&obd->obd_req_replay_queue)) {
01846                 req = list_entry(obd->obd_req_replay_queue.next,
01847                                      struct ptlrpc_request, rq_list);
01848                 req_transno = lustre_msg_get_transno(req->rq_reqmsg);
01849         }
01850 
01851         if (tdtd != NULL)
01852                 update_transno = distribute_txn_get_next_transno(tdtd);
01853 
01854         connected = atomic_read(&obd->obd_connected_clients);
01855         completed = connected - atomic_read(&obd->obd_req_replay_clients);
