01856         queue_len = obd->obd_requests_queued_for_recovery;
01857         next_transno = obd->obd_next_recovery_transno;
01858 
01859         CDEBUG(D_HA, "max: %d, connected: %d, completed: %d, queue_len: %d, "
01860                "req_transno: "LPU64", next_transno: "LPU64"\n",
01861                obd->obd_max_recoverable_clients, connected, completed,
01862                queue_len, req_transno, next_transno);
01863 
01864         if (obd->obd_abort_recovery) {
01865                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "waking for aborted recovery\n");
01866                 wake_up = 1;
01867         } else if (obd->obd_recovery_expired) {
01868                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "waking for expired recovery\n");
01869                 wake_up = 1;
01870         } else if (tdtd != NULL && req != NULL &&
01871                    is_req_replayed_by_update(req)) {
01872                 LASSERTF(req_transno < next_transno, "req_transno "LPU64
01873                          "next_transno"LPU64"\n", req_transno, next_transno);
01874                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "waking for duplicate req ("LPU64")\n",
01875                        req_transno);
01876                 wake_up = 1;
01877         } else if (req_transno == next_transno ||
01878                    (update_transno != 0 && update_transno <= next_transno)) {
01879                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "waking for next ("LPD64")\n", next_transno);
01880                 wake_up = 1;
01881         } else if (queue_len > 0 &&
01882                    queue_len == atomic_read(&obd->obd_req_replay_clients)) {
01883                 int d_lvl = D_HA;
01885                 LASSERTF(req_transno >= next_transno,
01886                          "req_transno: "LPU64", next_transno: "LPU64"\n",
01887                          req_transno, next_transno);
01888                 if (req_transno > obd->obd_last_committed &&
01889                     !obd->obd_version_recov)
01890                         d_lvl = D_ERROR;
01891                 CDEBUG(d_lvl,
01892                        "%s: waking for gap in transno, VBR is %s (skip: "
01893                        LPD64", ql: %d, comp: %d, conn: %d, next: "LPD64
01894                        ", next_update "LPD64" last_committed: "LPD64")\n",
01895                        obd->obd_name, obd->obd_version_recov ? "ON" : "OFF",
01896                        next_transno, queue_len, completed, connected,
01897                        req_transno, update_transno, obd->obd_last_committed);
01898                 obd->obd_next_recovery_transno = req_transno;
01899                 wake_up = 1;
01900         } else if (atomic_read(&obd->obd_req_replay_clients) == 0) {
01901                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "waking for completed recovery\n");
01902                 wake_up = 1;
01903         } else if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_MDS_RECOVERY_ACCEPTS_GAPS)) {
01904                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "accepting transno gaps is explicitly allowed"
01905                        " by fail_lock, waking up ("LPD64")\n", next_transno);
01906                 obd->obd_next_recovery_transno = req_transno;
01907                 wake_up = 1;
01908         }
01909         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01910         return wake_up;
01911 }
01912 
01913 static int check_for_next_lock(struct lu_target *lut)
01914 {
01915         struct obd_device *obd = lut->lut_obd;
01916         int wake_up = 0;
01917 
01918         spin_lock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01919         if (!list_empty(&obd->obd_lock_replay_queue)) {
01920                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "waking for next lock\n");
01921                 wake_up = 1;
01922         } else if (atomic_read(&obd->obd_lock_replay_clients) == 0) {
01923                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "waking for completed lock replay\n");
01924                 wake_up = 1;
01925         } else if (obd->obd_abort_recovery) {
01926                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "waking for aborted recovery\n");
01927                 wake_up = 1;
01928         } else if (obd->obd_recovery_expired) {
01929                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "waking for expired recovery\n");
01930                 wake_up = 1;
01931         }
01932         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01933 
01934         return wake_up;
01935 }
01936 
01942 static int target_recovery_overseer(struct lu_target *lut,
01943                                     int (*check_routine)(struct lu_target *),
01944                                     int (*health_check)(struct obd_export *))
01945 {
01946         struct obd_device       *obd = lut->lut_obd;
01947         struct target_distribute_txn_data *tdtd;
01948 repeat:
01949         if ((obd->obd_recovery_start != 0) && (cfs_time_current_sec() >=
01950               (obd->obd_recovery_start + obd->obd_recovery_time_hard))) {
01951                 __u64 next_update_transno = 0;
01952 
01953                 /* Only abort the recovery if there are no update recovery
01954                  * left in the queue */
01955                 spin_lock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01956                 if (lut->lut_tdtd != NULL) {
01957                         next_update_transno =
01958                                 distribute_txn_get_next_transno(lut->lut_tdtd);
01959 
01960                         tdtd = lut->lut_tdtd;
01961                         /* If next_update_transno == 0, it probably because
01962                          * updatelog retrieve threads did not get any records
01963                          * yet, let's wait those threads stopped */
01964                         if (next_update_transno == 0) {
01965                                 struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
01966 
01967                                 l_wait_event(tdtd->tdtd_recovery_threads_waitq,
01968                                        atomic_read(
01969                                        &tdtd->tdtd_recovery_threads_count) == 0,
01970                                        &lwi);
01971 
01972                                 next_update_transno =
01973                                         distribute_txn_get_next_transno(
01974                                                                 lut->lut_tdtd);
01975                         }
01976                 }
01977 
01978                 if (next_update_transno != 0 && !obd->obd_abort_recovery) {
01979                         obd->obd_next_recovery_transno = next_update_transno;
01980                         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01981                         /* Disconnect unfinished exports from clients, and
01982                          * keep connection from MDT to make sure the update
01983                          * recovery will still keep trying until some one
01984                          * manually abort the recovery */
01985                         class_disconnect_stale_exports(obd,
01986                                                 exp_finished_or_from_mdt);
01987                         /* Abort all of replay and replay lock req from
01988                          * clients */
01989                         abort_req_replay_queue(obd);
01990                         abort_lock_replay_queue(obd);
01991                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: there are still update replay ("LPX64
01992                                ")in the queue.\n", obd->obd_name,
01993                                next_update_transno);
01994                 } else {
01995                         obd->obd_abort_recovery = 1;
01996                         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01997                         CWARN("%s recovery is aborted by hard timeout\n",
01998                               obd->obd_name);
01999                 }
02000         }
02001 
02002         while (wait_event_timeout(obd->obd_next_transno_waitq,
02003                                   check_routine(lut),
02004                                   msecs_to_jiffies(60 * MSEC_PER_SEC)) == 0)
02005                 /* wait indefinitely for event, but don't trigger watchdog */;
02006 
02007         if (obd->obd_abort_recovery) {
02008                 CWARN("recovery is aborted, evict exports in recovery\n");
02009                 if (lut->lut_tdtd != NULL) {
02010                         struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
02011 
02012                         tdtd = lut->lut_tdtd;
02013                         /* Let's wait all of the update log recovery thread
02014                          * finished */
02015                         l_wait_event(tdtd->tdtd_recovery_threads_waitq,
02016                          atomic_read(&tdtd->tdtd_recovery_threads_count) == 0,
02017                              &lwi);
02018                         /* Then abort the update recovery list */
02019                         dtrq_list_dump(lut->lut_tdtd, D_ERROR);
02020                         dtrq_list_destroy(lut->lut_tdtd);
02021                 }
02022 
02024                 class_disconnect_stale_exports(obd, exp_finished);
02025                 return 1;
02026         } else if (obd->obd_recovery_expired) {
02027                 obd->obd_recovery_expired = 0;
02029                 LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: recovery is timed out, "
02030                               "evict stale exports\n", obd->obd_name);
02032                 class_disconnect_stale_exports(obd, health_check);
02033 
02035                 spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
02036                 obd->obd_version_recov = 1;
02037                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
02042                 extend_recovery_timer(obd, RECONNECT_DELAY_MAX, true);
02044                 goto repeat;
02045         }
02046         return 0;
02047 }
02048 
02049 static struct ptlrpc_request *target_next_replay_lock(struct lu_target *lut)
02050 {
02051         struct obd_device       *obd = lut->lut_obd;
02052         struct ptlrpc_request *req = NULL;
02053 
02054         CDEBUG(D_HA, "Waiting for lock\n");
02055         if (target_recovery_overseer(lut, check_for_next_lock,
02056                                      exp_lock_replay_healthy))
02057                 abort_lock_replay_queue(obd);
02058 
02059         spin_lock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02060         if (!list_empty(&obd->obd_lock_replay_queue)) {
02061                 req = list_entry(obd->obd_lock_replay_queue.next,
02062                                      struct ptlrpc_request, rq_list);
02063                 list_del_init(&req->rq_list);
02064                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02065         } else {
02066                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02067                 LASSERT(list_empty(&obd->obd_lock_replay_queue));
02068                 LASSERT(atomic_read(&obd->obd_lock_replay_clients) == 0);
02070                 class_disconnect_stale_exports(obd, exp_vbr_healthy);
02071         }
02072         return req;
02073 }
02074 
02075 static struct ptlrpc_request *target_next_final_ping(struct obd_device *obd)
02076 {
02077         struct ptlrpc_request *req = NULL;
02078 
02079         spin_lock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02080         if (!list_empty(&obd->obd_final_req_queue)) {
02081                 req = list_entry(obd->obd_final_req_queue.next,
02082                                      struct ptlrpc_request, rq_list);
02083                 list_del_init(&req->rq_list);
02084                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02085                 if (req->rq_export->exp_in_recovery) {
02086                         spin_lock(&req->rq_export->exp_lock);
02087                         req->rq_export->exp_in_recovery = 0;
02088                         spin_unlock(&req->rq_export->exp_lock);
02089                 }
02090         } else {
02091                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02092         }
02093         return req;
02094 }
02095 
02096 static void handle_recovery_req(struct ptlrpc_thread *thread,
02097                                 struct ptlrpc_request *req,
02098                                 svc_handler_t handler)
02099 {
02100         ENTRY;
02101 
02106         if (req->rq_export->exp_disconnected)
02107                 RETURN_EXIT;
02108 
02109         req->rq_session.lc_thread = thread;
02110         req->rq_svc_thread = thread;
02111         req->rq_svc_thread->t_env->le_ses = &req->rq_session;
02112 
02113         /* thread context */
02114         lu_context_enter(&thread->t_env->le_ctx);
02115         (void)handler(req);
02116         lu_context_exit(&thread->t_env->le_ctx);
02117 
02118         /* don't reset timer for final stage */
02119         if (!exp_finished(req->rq_export)) {
02120                 int to = obd_timeout;
02121 
02126                 if (!AT_OFF) {
02127                         struct ptlrpc_service_part *svcpt;
02128 
02129                         svcpt = req->rq_rqbd->rqbd_svcpt;
02130                         /* If the server sent early reply for this request,
02131                          * the client will recalculate the timeout according to
02132                          * current server estimate service time, so we will
02133                          * use the maxium timeout here for waiting the client
02134                          * sending the next req */
02135                         to = max((int)at_est2timeout(
02136                                  at_get(&svcpt->scp_at_estimate)),
02137                                  (int)lustre_msg_get_timeout(req->rq_reqmsg));
02138                         /* Add 2 net_latency, one for balance rq_deadline
02139                          * (see ptl_send_rpc), one for resend the req to server,
02140                          * Note: client will pack net_latency in replay req
02141                          * (see ptlrpc_replay_req) */
02142                         to += 2 * lustre_msg_get_service_time(req->rq_reqmsg);
02143                 }
02144                 extend_recovery_timer(class_exp2obd(req->rq_export), to, true);
02145         }
02146         EXIT;
02147 }
02148 
02150 static int check_for_recovery_ready(struct lu_target *lut)
02151 {
02152         struct obd_device *obd = lut->lut_obd;
02153         unsigned int clnts = atomic_read(&obd->obd_connected_clients);
02154 
02155         CDEBUG(D_HA, "connected %d stale %d max_recoverable_clients %d"
02156                " abort %d expired %d\n", clnts, obd->obd_stale_clients,
02157                obd->obd_max_recoverable_clients, obd->obd_abort_recovery,
02158                obd->obd_recovery_expired);
02159 
02160         if (!obd->obd_abort_recovery && !obd->obd_recovery_expired) {
02161                 LASSERT(clnts <= obd->obd_max_recoverable_clients);
02162                 if (clnts + obd->obd_stale_clients <
02163                     obd->obd_max_recoverable_clients)
02164                         return 0;
02165         }
02166 
02167         if (lut->lut_tdtd != NULL) {
02168                 if (!lut->lut_tdtd->tdtd_replay_ready &&
02169                     !obd->obd_abort_recovery) {
02170                         /* Let's extend recovery timer, in case the recovery
02171                          * timer expired, and some clients got evicted */
02172                         extend_recovery_timer(obd, obd->obd_recovery_timeout,
02173                                               true);
02174                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s update recovery is not ready,"
02175                                " extend recovery %d\n", obd->obd_name,
02176                                obd->obd_recovery_timeout);
02177                         return 0;
02178                 } else {
02179                         dtrq_list_dump(lut->lut_tdtd, D_HA);
02180                 }
02181         }
02182 
02183         return 1;
02184 }
02185 
02186 enum {
02187         REQUEST_RECOVERY = 1,
02188         UPDATE_RECOVERY = 2,
02189 };
02190 
02191 static __u64 get_next_replay_req_transno(struct obd_device *obd)
02192 {
02193         __u64 transno = 0;
02194 
02195         if (!list_empty(&obd->obd_req_replay_queue)) {
02196                 struct ptlrpc_request *req;
02197 
02198                 req = list_entry(obd->obd_req_replay_queue.next,
02199                                  struct ptlrpc_request, rq_list);
02200                 transno = lustre_msg_get_transno(req->rq_reqmsg);
02201         }
02202 
02203         return transno;
02204 }
02205 
02206 static __u64 get_next_transno(struct lu_target *lut, int *type)
02207 {
02208         struct obd_device *obd = lut->lut_obd;
02209         struct target_distribute_txn_data *tdtd = lut->lut_tdtd;
02210         __u64 transno = 0;
02211         __u64 update_transno;
02212         ENTRY;
02213 
02214         transno = get_next_replay_req_transno(obd);
02215         if (type != NULL)
02216                 *type = REQUEST_RECOVERY;
02217 
02218         if (tdtd == NULL)
02219                 RETURN(transno);
02220 
02221         update_transno = distribute_txn_get_next_transno(tdtd);
02222         if (transno == 0 || (transno >= update_transno &&
02223                              update_transno != 0)) {
02224                 transno = update_transno;
02225                 if (type != NULL)
02226                         *type = UPDATE_RECOVERY;
02227         }
02228 
02229         RETURN(transno);
02230 }
02231 
02243 static void drop_duplicate_replay_req(struct lu_env *env,
02244                                       struct obd_device *obd,
02245                                       struct ptlrpc_request *req)
02246 {
02247         DEBUG_REQ(D_HA, req, "remove t"LPD64" from %s because of duplicate"
02248                   " update records are found.\n",
02249                   lustre_msg_get_transno(req->rq_reqmsg),
02250                   libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid));
02251 
02252         /* Right now, only for MDS reint operation update replay and
02253          * normal request replay can have the same transno */
02254         if (lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg) == MDS_REINT) {
02255                 req_capsule_set(&req->rq_pill, &RQF_MDS_REINT);
02256                 req->rq_status = req_capsule_server_pack(&req->rq_pill);
02257                 if (likely(req->rq_export))
02258                         target_committed_to_req(req);
02259                 lustre_msg_set_transno(req->rq_repmsg, req->rq_transno);
02260                 target_send_reply(req, req->rq_status, 0);
02261         } else {
02262                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "wrong opc" "from %s\n",
02263                 libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid));
02264         }
02265         target_exp_dequeue_req_replay(req);
02266         target_request_copy_put(req);
02267         obd->obd_replayed_requests++;
02268 }
02269 
02270 static void replay_request_or_update(struct lu_env *env,
02271                                      struct lu_target *lut,
02272                                      struct target_recovery_data *trd,
02273                                      struct ptlrpc_thread *thread)
02274 {
02275         struct obd_device *obd = lut->lut_obd;
02276         struct ptlrpc_request *req = NULL;
02277         int                     type;
02278         __u64                   transno;
02279         ENTRY;
02280 
02281         CDEBUG(D_HA, "Waiting for transno "LPD64"\n",
02282                obd->obd_next_recovery_transno);
02283 
02284         /* Replay all of request and update by transno */
02285         do {
02286                 struct target_distribute_txn_data *tdtd = lut->lut_tdtd;
02287 
02288                 CFS_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_TGT_REPLAY_DELAY2, cfs_fail_val);
02289 
02295                 CFS_FAIL_TIMEOUT_MS(OBD_FAIL_TGT_REPLAY_DELAY, 300);
02296 
02297                 if (target_recovery_overseer(lut, check_for_next_transno,
02298                                         exp_req_replay_healthy_or_from_mdt)) {
02299                         abort_req_replay_queue(obd);
02300                         abort_lock_replay_queue(obd);
02301                         goto abort;
02302                 }
02303 
02304                 spin_lock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02305                 transno = get_next_transno(lut, &type);
02306                 if (type == REQUEST_RECOVERY && transno != 0) {
02307                         /* Drop replay request from client side, if the
02308                          * replay has been executed by update with the
02309                          * same transno */
02310                         req = list_entry(obd->obd_req_replay_queue.next,
02311                                         struct ptlrpc_request, rq_list);
02312 
02313                         list_del_init(&req->rq_list);
02314                         obd->obd_requests_queued_for_recovery--;
02315                         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02316 
02317                         /* Let's check if the request has been redone by
02318                          * update replay */
02319                         if (is_req_replayed_by_update(req)) {
02320                                 struct distribute_txn_replay_req *dtrq;
02321 
02322                                 dtrq = distribute_txn_lookup_finish_list(tdtd,
02323                                                                    req->rq_xid);
02324                                 LASSERT(dtrq != NULL);
02325                                 spin_lock(&tdtd->tdtd_replay_list_lock);
02326                                 list_del_init(&dtrq->dtrq_list);
02327                                 spin_unlock(&tdtd->tdtd_replay_list_lock);
02328                                 dtrq_destroy(dtrq);
02329 
02330                                 drop_duplicate_replay_req(env, obd, req);
02331 
02332                                 continue;
02333                         }
02334 
02335                         LASSERT(trd->trd_processing_task == current_pid());
02336                         DEBUG_REQ(D_HA, req, "processing t"LPD64" from %s",
02337                                   lustre_msg_get_transno(req->rq_reqmsg),
02338                                   libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid));
02339 
02340                         handle_recovery_req(thread, req,
02341                                             trd->trd_recovery_handler);
02346                         spin_lock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02347                         obd->obd_next_recovery_transno++;
02348                         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02349                         target_exp_dequeue_req_replay(req);
02350                         target_request_copy_put(req);
02351                         obd->obd_replayed_requests++;
02352                 } else if (type == UPDATE_RECOVERY && transno != 0) {
02353                         struct distribute_txn_replay_req *dtrq;
02354                         int rc;
02355 
02356                         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02357 
02358                         LASSERT(tdtd != NULL);
02359                         dtrq = distribute_txn_get_next_req(tdtd);
02360                         lu_context_enter(&thread->t_env->le_ctx);
02361                         rc = tdtd->tdtd_replay_handler(env, tdtd, dtrq);
02362                         lu_context_exit(&thread->t_env->le_ctx);
02363                         extend_recovery_timer(obd, obd_timeout, true);
02364 
02365                         if (rc == 0 && dtrq->dtrq_xid != 0) {
02366                                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "Move x"LPU64" t"LPU64
02367                                        " to finish list\n", dtrq->dtrq_xid,
02368                                        dtrq->dtrq_master_transno);
02369 
02370                                 /* Add it to the replay finish list */
02371                                 spin_lock(&tdtd->tdtd_replay_list_lock);
02372                                 list_add(&dtrq->dtrq_list,
02373                                          &tdtd->tdtd_replay_finish_list);
02374                                 spin_unlock(&tdtd->tdtd_replay_list_lock);
02375 
02376                                 spin_lock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02377                                 if (transno == obd->obd_next_recovery_transno)
02378                                         obd->obd_next_recovery_transno++;
02379                                 else if (transno >
02380                                          obd->obd_next_recovery_transno)
02381                                         obd->obd_next_recovery_transno =
02382                                                                 transno + 1;
02383                                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02384                         } else {
02385                                 dtrq_destroy(dtrq);
02386                         }
02387                 } else {
02388                         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02389 abort:
02390                         LASSERT(list_empty(&obd->obd_req_replay_queue));
02391                         LASSERT(atomic_read(&obd->obd_req_replay_clients) == 0);
02393                         class_disconnect_stale_exports(obd, exp_vbr_healthy);
02394                         break;
02395                 }
02396         } while (1);
02397 }
02398 
02399 static int target_recovery_thread(void *arg)
02400 {
02401         struct lu_target *lut = arg;
02402         struct obd_device *obd = lut->lut_obd;
02403         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
02404         struct target_recovery_data *trd = &obd->obd_recovery_data;
02405         unsigned long delta;
02406         struct lu_env *env;
02407         struct ptlrpc_thread *thread = NULL;
02408         int rc = 0;
02409         ENTRY;
02410 
02411         unshare_fs_struct();
02412         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(thread);
02413         if (thread == NULL)
02414                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02415 
02416         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(env);
02417         if (env == NULL) {
02418                 OBD_FREE_PTR(thread);
02419                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02420         }
02421 
02422         rc = lu_context_init(&env->le_ctx, LCT_MD_THREAD | LCT_DT_THREAD);
02423         if (rc) {
02424                 OBD_FREE_PTR(thread);
02425                 OBD_FREE_PTR(env);
02426                 RETURN(rc);
02427         }
02428 
02429         thread->t_env = env;
02430         thread->t_id = -1; /* force filter_iobuf_get/put to use local buffers */
02431         env->le_ctx.lc_thread = thread;
02432         tgt_io_thread_init(thread); /* init thread_big_cache for IO requests */
02433         thread->t_watchdog = NULL;
02434 
02435         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: started recovery thread pid %d\n", obd->obd_name,
02436                current_pid());
02437         trd->trd_processing_task = current_pid();
02438 
02439         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
02440         obd->obd_recovering = 1;
02441         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
02442         complete(&trd->trd_starting);
02443 
02444         /* first of all, we have to know the first transno to replay */
02445         if (target_recovery_overseer(lut, check_for_recovery_ready,
02446                                      exp_connect_healthy)) {
02447                 abort_req_replay_queue(obd);
02448                 abort_lock_replay_queue(obd);
02449                 if (lut->lut_tdtd != NULL)
02450                         dtrq_list_destroy(lut->lut_tdtd);
02451         }
02452 
02453         /* next stage: replay requests or update */
02454         delta = jiffies;
02455         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "1: request replay stage - %d clients from t"LPU64"\n",
02456                atomic_read(&obd->obd_req_replay_clients),
02457                obd->obd_next_recovery_transno);
02458         replay_request_or_update(env, lut, trd, thread);
02459 
02463         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "2: lock replay stage - %d clients\n",
02464                atomic_read(&obd->obd_lock_replay_clients));
02465         while ((req = target_next_replay_lock(lut))) {
02466                 LASSERT(trd->trd_processing_task == current_pid());
02467                 DEBUG_REQ(D_HA, req, "processing lock from %s: ",
02468                           libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid));
02469                 handle_recovery_req(thread, req,
02470                                     trd->trd_recovery_handler);
02471                 target_request_copy_put(req);
02472                 obd->obd_replayed_locks++;
02473         }
02474 
02479         CFS_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_TGT_REPLAY_RECONNECT, cfs_fail_val);
02480         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "3: final stage - process recovery completion pings\n");
02482         tgt_boot_epoch_update(lut);
02483         /* We drop recoverying flag to forward all new requests
02484          * to regular mds_handle() since now */
02485         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
02486         obd->obd_recovering = obd->obd_abort_recovery = 0;
02487         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
02488         spin_lock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02489         target_cancel_recovery_timer(obd);
02490         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02491         while ((req = target_next_final_ping(obd))) {
02492                 LASSERT(trd->trd_processing_task == current_pid());
02493                 DEBUG_REQ(D_HA, req, "processing final ping from %s: ",
02494                           libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid));
02495                 handle_recovery_req(thread, req,
02496                                     trd->trd_recovery_handler);
02497                 /* Because the waiting client can not send ping to server,
02498                  * so we need refresh the last_request_time, to avoid the
02499                  * export is being evicted */
02500                 ptlrpc_update_export_timer(req->rq_export, 0);
02501                 target_request_copy_put(req);
02502         }
02503 
02504         delta = jiffies_to_msecs(jiffies - delta) / MSEC_PER_SEC;
02505         CDEBUG(D_INFO,"4: recovery completed in %lus - %d/%d reqs/locks\n",
02506               delta, obd->obd_replayed_requests, obd->obd_replayed_locks);
02507         if (delta > OBD_RECOVERY_TIME_SOFT) {
02508                 CWARN("too long recovery - read logs\n");
02509                 libcfs_debug_dumplog();
02510         }
02511 
02512         target_finish_recovery(lut);
02513 
02514         lu_context_fini(&env->le_ctx);
02515         trd->trd_processing_task = 0;
02516         complete(&trd->trd_finishing);
02517 
02518         tgt_io_thread_done(thread);
02519         OBD_FREE_PTR(thread);
02520         OBD_FREE_PTR(env);
02521         RETURN(rc);
02522 }
02523 
02524 static int target_start_recovery_thread(struct lu_target *lut,
02525                                         svc_handler_t handler)
02526 {
02527         struct obd_device *obd = lut->lut_obd;
02528         int rc = 0;
02529         struct target_recovery_data *trd = &obd->obd_recovery_data;
02530         int index;
02531 
02532         memset(trd, 0, sizeof(*trd));
02533         init_completion(&trd->trd_starting);
02534         init_completion(&trd->trd_finishing);
02535         trd->trd_recovery_handler = handler;
02536 
02537         rc = server_name2index(obd->obd_name, &index, NULL);
02538         if (rc < 0)
02539                 return rc;
02540 
02541         if (!IS_ERR(kthread_run(target_recovery_thread,
02542                                 lut, "tgt_recover_%d", index))) {
02543                 wait_for_completion(&trd->trd_starting);
02544                 LASSERT(obd->obd_recovering != 0);
02545         } else {
02546                 rc = -ECHILD;
02547         }
02548 
02549         return rc;
02550 }
02551 
02552 void target_stop_recovery_thread(struct obd_device *obd)
02553 {
02554         if (obd->obd_recovery_data.trd_processing_task > 0) {
02555                 struct target_recovery_data *trd = &obd->obd_recovery_data;
02557                 spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
02558                 if (obd->obd_recovering) {
02559                         CERROR("%s: Aborting recovery\n", obd->obd_name);
02560                         obd->obd_abort_recovery = 1;
02561                         wake_up(&obd->obd_next_transno_waitq);
02562                 }
02563                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
02564                 wait_for_completion(&trd->trd_finishing);
02565         }
02566 }
02567 EXPORT_SYMBOL(target_stop_recovery_thread);
02568 
02569 void target_recovery_fini(struct obd_device *obd)
02570 {
02571         class_disconnect_exports(obd);
02572         target_stop_recovery_thread(obd);
02573         target_cleanup_recovery(obd);
02574 }
02575 EXPORT_SYMBOL(target_recovery_fini);
02576 
02577 static void target_recovery_expired(unsigned long castmeharder)
02578 {
02579         struct obd_device *obd = (struct obd_device *)castmeharder;
02580         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: recovery timed out; %d clients are still in recovery"
02581                " after %lds (%d clients connected)\n",
02582                obd->obd_name, atomic_read(&obd->obd_lock_replay_clients),
02583                cfs_time_current_sec()- obd->obd_recovery_start,
02584                atomic_read(&obd->obd_connected_clients));
02585 
02586         obd->obd_recovery_expired = 1;
02587         wake_up(&obd->obd_next_transno_waitq);
02588 }
02589 
02590 void target_recovery_init(struct lu_target *lut, svc_handler_t handler)
02591 {
02592         struct obd_device *obd = lut->lut_obd;
02593 
02594         if (obd->obd_max_recoverable_clients == 0) {
02596                 tgt_boot_epoch_update(lut);
02597                 return;
02598         }
02599 
02600         CDEBUG(D_HA, "RECOVERY: service %s, %d recoverable clients, "
02601                "last_transno "LPU64"\n", obd->obd_name,
02602                obd->obd_max_recoverable_clients, obd->obd_last_committed);
02603         LASSERT(obd->obd_stopping == 0);
02604         obd->obd_next_recovery_transno = obd->obd_last_committed + 1;
02605         obd->obd_recovery_start = 0;
02606         obd->obd_recovery_end = 0;
02607 
02608         cfs_timer_init(&obd->obd_recovery_timer, target_recovery_expired, obd);
02609         target_start_recovery_thread(lut, handler);
02610 }
02611 EXPORT_SYMBOL(target_recovery_init);
02612 
02613 static int target_process_req_flags(struct obd_device *obd,
02614                                     struct ptlrpc_request *req)
02615 {
02616         struct obd_export *exp = req->rq_export;
02617         LASSERT(exp != NULL);
02618         if (lustre_msg_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSG_REQ_REPLAY_DONE) {
02619                 /* client declares he's ready to replay locks */
02620                 spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
02621                 if (exp->exp_req_replay_needed) {
02622                         exp->exp_req_replay_needed = 0;
02623                         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
02624 
02625                         LASSERT_ATOMIC_POS(&obd->obd_req_replay_clients);
02626                         atomic_dec(&obd->obd_req_replay_clients);
02627                 } else {
02628                         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
02629                 }
02630         }
02631         if (lustre_msg_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSG_LOCK_REPLAY_DONE) {
02632                 /* client declares he's ready to complete recovery
02633                  * so, we put the request on th final queue */
02634                 spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
02635                 if (exp->exp_lock_replay_needed) {
02636                         exp->exp_lock_replay_needed = 0;
02637                         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
02638 
02639                         LASSERT_ATOMIC_POS(&obd->obd_lock_replay_clients);
02640                         atomic_dec(&obd->obd_lock_replay_clients);
02641                 } else {
02642                         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
02643                 }
02644         }
02645         return 0;
02646 }
02647 
02648 int target_queue_recovery_request(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
02649                                   struct obd_device *obd)
02650 {
02651         __u64 transno = lustre_msg_get_transno(req->rq_reqmsg);
02652         struct ptlrpc_request *reqiter;
02653         int inserted = 0;
02654         ENTRY;
02655 
02656         if (obd->obd_recovery_data.trd_processing_task == current_pid()) {
02657                 /* Processing the queue right now, don't re-add. */
02658                 RETURN(1);
02659         }
02660 
02661         target_process_req_flags(obd, req);
02662 
02663         if (lustre_msg_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSG_LOCK_REPLAY_DONE) {
02664                 /* client declares he's ready to complete recovery
02665                  * so, we put the request on th final queue */
02666                 target_request_copy_get(req);
02667                 DEBUG_REQ(D_HA, req, "queue final req");
02668                 wake_up(&obd->obd_next_transno_waitq);
02669                 spin_lock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02670                 if (obd->obd_recovering) {
02671                         list_add_tail(&req->rq_list,
02672                                           &obd->obd_final_req_queue);
02673                 } else {
02674                         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02675                         target_request_copy_put(req);
02676                         RETURN(obd->obd_stopping ? -ENOTCONN : 1);
02677                 }
02678                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02679                 RETURN(0);
02680         }
02681         if (lustre_msg_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSG_REQ_REPLAY_DONE) {
02682                 /* client declares he's ready to replay locks */
02683                 target_request_copy_get(req);
02684                 DEBUG_REQ(D_HA, req, "queue lock replay req");
02685                 wake_up(&obd->obd_next_transno_waitq);
02686                 spin_lock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02687                 LASSERT(obd->obd_recovering);
02688                 /* usually due to recovery abort */
02689                 if (!req->rq_export->exp_in_recovery) {
02690                         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02691                         target_request_copy_put(req);
02692                         RETURN(-ENOTCONN);
02693                 }
02694                 LASSERT(req->rq_export->exp_lock_replay_needed);
02695                 list_add_tail(&req->rq_list, &obd->obd_lock_replay_queue);
02696                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02697                 RETURN(0);
02698         }
02699 
02700         /* CAVEAT EMPTOR: The incoming request message has been swabbed
02701          * (i.e. buflens etc are in my own byte order), but type-dependent
02702          * buffers (eg mdt_body, ost_body etc) have NOT been swabbed. */
02703 
02704         if (!transno) {
02705                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&req->rq_list);
02706                 DEBUG_REQ(D_HA, req, "not queueing");
02707                 RETURN(1);
02708         }
02709 
02710         /* If we're processing the queue, we want don't want to queue this
02711          * message.
02712          *
02713          * Also, if this request has a transno less than the one we're waiting
02714          * for, we should process it now.  It could (and currently always will)
02715          * be an open request for a descriptor that was opened some time ago.
02716          *
02717          * Also, a resent, replayed request that has already been
02718          * handled will pass through here and be processed immediately.
02719          */
02720         CDEBUG(D_HA, "Next recovery transno: "LPU64
02721                ", current: "LPU64", replaying\n",
02722                obd->obd_next_recovery_transno, transno);
02723 
02724         /* If the request has been replayed by update replay, then sends this
02725          * request to the recovery thread (replay_request_or_update()), where
02726          * it will be handled */
02727         spin_lock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02728         if (transno < obd->obd_next_recovery_transno &&
02729             !is_req_replayed_by_update(req)) {
02730                 /* Processing the queue right now, don't re-add. */
02731                 LASSERT(list_empty(&req->rq_list));
02732                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02733                 RETURN(1);
02734         }
02735         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02736 
02737         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_TGT_REPLAY_DROP))
02738                 RETURN(0);
02739 
02740         target_request_copy_get(req);
02741         if (!req->rq_export->exp_in_recovery) {
02742                 target_request_copy_put(req);
02743                 RETURN(-ENOTCONN);
02744         }
02745         LASSERT(req->rq_export->exp_req_replay_needed);
02746 
02747         if (target_exp_enqueue_req_replay(req)) {
02748                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "dropping resent queued req");
02749                 target_request_copy_put(req);
02750                 RETURN(0);
02751         }
02752 
02753         /* XXX O(n^2) */
02754         spin_lock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02755         LASSERT(obd->obd_recovering);
02756         list_for_each_entry(reqiter, &obd->obd_req_replay_queue, rq_list) {
02757                 if (lustre_msg_get_transno(reqiter->rq_reqmsg) > transno) {
02758                         list_add_tail(&req->rq_list, &reqiter->rq_list);
02759                         inserted = 1;
02760                         goto added;
02761                 }
02762 
02763                 if (unlikely(lustre_msg_get_transno(reqiter->rq_reqmsg) ==
02764                              transno)) {
02765                         DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "dropping replay: transno "
02766                                   "has been claimed by another client");
02767                         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02768                         target_exp_dequeue_req_replay(req);
02769                         target_request_copy_put(req);
02770                         RETURN(0);
02771                 }
02772         }
02773 added:
02774         if (!inserted)
02775                 list_add_tail(&req->rq_list, &obd->obd_req_replay_queue);
02776 
02777         obd->obd_requests_queued_for_recovery++;
02778         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
02779         wake_up(&obd->obd_next_transno_waitq);
02780         RETURN(0);
02781 }
02782 
02783 int target_handle_ping(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
02784 {
02785         obd_ping(req->rq_svc_thread->t_env, req->rq_export);
02786         return req_capsule_server_pack(&req->rq_pill);
02787 }
02788 
02789 void target_committed_to_req(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
02790 {
02791         struct obd_export *exp = req->rq_export;
02792 
02793         if (!exp->exp_obd->obd_no_transno && req->rq_repmsg != NULL)
02794                 lustre_msg_set_last_committed(req->rq_repmsg,
02795                                               exp->exp_last_committed);
02796         else
02797                 DEBUG_REQ(D_IOCTL, req, "not sending last_committed update (%d/"
02798                           "%d)", exp->exp_obd->obd_no_transno,
02799                           req->rq_repmsg == NULL);
02800 
02801         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "last_committed "LPU64", transno "LPU64", xid "LPU64"\n",
02802                exp->exp_last_committed, req->rq_transno, req->rq_xid);
02803 }
02804 
02805 #endif /* HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT */
02806 
02810 int target_pack_pool_reply(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
02811 {
02812         struct obd_device *obd;
02813         ENTRY;
02814 
02815         /* Check that we still have all structures alive as this may
02816          * be some late RPC at shutdown time. */
02817         if (unlikely(!req->rq_export || !req->rq_export->exp_obd ||
02818                      !exp_connect_lru_resize(req->rq_export))) {
02819                 lustre_msg_set_slv(req->rq_repmsg, 0);
02820                 lustre_msg_set_limit(req->rq_repmsg, 0);
02821                 RETURN(0);
02822         }
02823 
02824         /* OBD is alive here as export is alive, which we checked above. */
02825         obd = req->rq_export->exp_obd;
02826 
02827         read_lock(&obd->obd_pool_lock);
02828         lustre_msg_set_slv(req->rq_repmsg, obd->obd_pool_slv);
02829         lustre_msg_set_limit(req->rq_repmsg, obd->obd_pool_limit);
02830         read_unlock(&obd->obd_pool_lock);
02831 
02832         RETURN(0);
02833 }
02834 
02835 static int target_send_reply_msg(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
02836                                  int rc, int fail_id)
02837 {
02838         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK_ORSET(fail_id & ~OBD_FAIL_ONCE, OBD_FAIL_ONCE)) {
02839                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "dropping reply");
02840                 return -ECOMM;
02841         }
02842         /* We can have a null rq_reqmsg in the event of bad signature or
02843          * no context when unwrapping */
02844         if (req->rq_reqmsg &&
02845             unlikely(lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg) == MDS_REINT &&
02846             OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_MDS_REINT_MULTI_NET_REP)))
02847                 return -ECOMM;
02848 
02849         if (unlikely(rc)) {
02850                 DEBUG_REQ(D_NET, req, "processing error (%d)", rc);
02851                 req->rq_status = rc;
02852                 return ptlrpc_send_error(req, 1);
02853         } else {
02854                 DEBUG_REQ(D_NET, req, "sending reply");
02855         }
02856 
02857         return ptlrpc_send_reply(req, PTLRPC_REPLY_MAYBE_DIFFICULT);
02858 }
02859 
02860 void target_send_reply(struct ptlrpc_request *req, int rc, int fail_id)
02861 {
02862         struct ptlrpc_service_part *svcpt;
02863         int                        netrc;
02864         struct ptlrpc_reply_state *rs;
02865         struct obd_export         *exp;
02866         ENTRY;
02867 
02868         if (req->rq_no_reply) {
02869                 EXIT;
02870                 return;
02871         }
02872 
02873         svcpt = req->rq_rqbd->rqbd_svcpt;
02874         rs = req->rq_reply_state;
02875         if (rs == NULL || !rs->rs_difficult) {
02876                 /* no notifiers */
02877                 target_send_reply_msg (req, rc, fail_id);
02878                 EXIT;
02879                 return;
02880         }
02881 
02882         /* must be an export if locks saved */
02883         LASSERT(req->rq_export != NULL);
02884         /* req/reply consistent */
02885         LASSERT(rs->rs_svcpt == svcpt);
02886 
02887         /* "fresh" reply */
02888         LASSERT(!rs->rs_scheduled);
02889         LASSERT(!rs->rs_scheduled_ever);
02890         LASSERT(!rs->rs_handled);
02891         LASSERT(!rs->rs_on_net);
02892         LASSERT(rs->rs_export == NULL);
02893         LASSERT(list_empty(&rs->rs_obd_list));
02894         LASSERT(list_empty(&rs->rs_exp_list));
02895 
02896         exp = class_export_get(req->rq_export);
02897 
02898         /* disable reply scheduling while I'm setting up */
02899         rs->rs_scheduled = 1;
02900         rs->rs_on_net    = 1;
02901         rs->rs_xid       = req->rq_xid;
02902         rs->rs_transno   = req->rq_transno;
02903         rs->rs_export    = exp;
02904         rs->rs_opc       = lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg);
02905 
02906         spin_lock(&exp->exp_uncommitted_replies_lock);
02907         CDEBUG(D_NET, "rs transno = "LPU64", last committed = "LPU64"\n",
02908                rs->rs_transno, exp->exp_last_committed);
02909         if (rs->rs_transno > exp->exp_last_committed) {
02910                 /* not committed already */
02911                 list_add_tail(&rs->rs_obd_list,
02912                                   &exp->exp_uncommitted_replies);
02913         }
02914         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_uncommitted_replies_lock);
02915 
02916         spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
02917         list_add_tail(&rs->rs_exp_list, &exp->exp_outstanding_replies);
02918         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
02919 
02920         netrc = target_send_reply_msg(req, rc, fail_id);
02921 
02922         spin_lock(&svcpt->scp_rep_lock);
02923 
02924         atomic_inc(&svcpt->scp_nreps_difficult);
02925 
02926         if (netrc != 0) {
02927                 /* error sending: reply is off the net.  Also we need +1
02928                  * reply ref until ptlrpc_handle_rs() is done
02929                  * with the reply state (if the send was successful, there
02930                  * would have been +1 ref for the net, which
02931                  * reply_out_callback leaves alone) */
02932                 rs->rs_on_net = 0;
02933                 ptlrpc_rs_addref(rs);
02934         }
02935 
02936         spin_lock(&rs->rs_lock);
02937         if (rs->rs_transno <= exp->exp_last_committed ||
02938             (!rs->rs_on_net && !rs->rs_no_ack) ||
02939             list_empty(&rs->rs_exp_list) ||     /* completed already */
02940             list_empty(&rs->rs_obd_list)) {
02941                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "Schedule reply immediately\n");
02942                 ptlrpc_dispatch_difficult_reply(rs);
02943         } else {
02944                 list_add(&rs->rs_list, &svcpt->scp_rep_active);
02945                 rs->rs_scheduled = 0;   /* allow notifier to schedule */
02946         }
02947         spin_unlock(&rs->rs_lock);
02948         spin_unlock(&svcpt->scp_rep_lock);
02949         EXIT;
02950 }
02951 
02952 enum ldlm_mode lck_compat_array[] = {
02953         [LCK_EX]    = LCK_COMPAT_EX,
02954         [LCK_PW]    = LCK_COMPAT_PW,
02955         [LCK_PR]    = LCK_COMPAT_PR,
02956         [LCK_CW]    = LCK_COMPAT_CW,
02957         [LCK_CR]    = LCK_COMPAT_CR,
02958         [LCK_NL]    = LCK_COMPAT_NL,
02959         [LCK_GROUP] = LCK_COMPAT_GROUP,
02960         [LCK_COS]   = LCK_COMPAT_COS,
02961 };
02962 
02967 int ldlm_error2errno(enum ldlm_error error)
02968 {
02969         int result;
02970 
02971         switch (error) {
02972         case ELDLM_OK:
02973         case ELDLM_LOCK_MATCHED:
02974                 result = 0;
02975                 break;
02976         case ELDLM_LOCK_CHANGED:
02977                 result = -ESTALE;
02978                 break;
02979         case ELDLM_LOCK_ABORTED:
02980                 result = -ENAVAIL;
02981                 break;
02982         case ELDLM_LOCK_REPLACED:
02983                 result = -ESRCH;
02984                 break;
02985         case ELDLM_NO_LOCK_DATA:
02986                 result = -ENOENT;
02987                 break;
02988         case ELDLM_NAMESPACE_EXISTS:
02989                 result = -EEXIST;
02990                 break;
02991         case ELDLM_BAD_NAMESPACE:
02992                 result = -EBADF;
02993                 break;
02994         default:
02995                 if (((int)error) < 0) { /* cast to signed type */
02996                         result = error; /* as ldlm_error can be unsigned */
02997                 } else {
02998                         CERROR("Invalid DLM result code: %d\n", error);
02999                         result = -EPROTO;
03000                 }
03001         }
03002         return result;
03003 }
03004 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ldlm_error2errno);
03005 
03009 enum ldlm_error ldlm_errno2error(int err_no)
03010 {
03011         int error;
03012 
03013         switch (err_no) {
03014         case 0:
03015                 error = ELDLM_OK;
03016                 break;
03017         case -ESTALE:
03018                 error = ELDLM_LOCK_CHANGED;
03019                 break;
03020         case -ENAVAIL:
03021                 error = ELDLM_LOCK_ABORTED;
03022                 break;
03023         case -ESRCH:
03024                 error = ELDLM_LOCK_REPLACED;
03025                 break;
03026         case -ENOENT:
03027                 error = ELDLM_NO_LOCK_DATA;
03028                 break;
03029         case -EEXIST:
03030                 error = ELDLM_NAMESPACE_EXISTS;
03031                 break;
03032         case -EBADF:
03033                 error = ELDLM_BAD_NAMESPACE;
03034                 break;
03035         default:
03036                 error = err_no;
03037         }
03038         return error;
03039 }

03041 #if LUSTRE_TRACKS_LOCK_EXP_REFS
03042 void ldlm_dump_export_locks(struct obd_export *exp)
03043 {
03044         spin_lock(&exp->exp_locks_list_guard);
03045         if (!list_empty(&exp->exp_locks_list)) {
03046                 struct ldlm_lock *lock;
03047 
03048                 CERROR("dumping locks for export %p,"
03049                        "ignore if the unmount doesn't hang\n", exp);
03050                 list_for_each_entry(lock, &exp->exp_locks_list,
03051                                         l_exp_refs_link)
03052                         LDLM_ERROR(lock, "lock:");
03053         }
03054         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_locks_list_guard);
03055 }
03056 #endif

03058 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
03059 static int target_bulk_timeout(void *data)
03060 {
03061         ENTRY;
03062         /* We don't fail the connection here, because having the export
03063          * killed makes the (vital) call to commitrw very sad.
03064          */
03065         RETURN(1);
03066 }
03067 
03068 static inline const char *bulk2type(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
03069 {
03070         if (req->rq_bulk_read)
03071                 return "READ";
03072         if (req->rq_bulk_write)
03073                 return "WRITE";
03074         return "UNKNOWN";
03075 }
03076 
03077 int target_bulk_io(struct obd_export *exp, struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc,
03078                    struct l_wait_info *lwi)
03079 {
03080         struct ptlrpc_request   *req = desc->bd_req;
03081         time_t                   start = cfs_time_current_sec();
03082         time_t                   deadline;
03083         int                      rc = 0;
03084 
03085         ENTRY;
03086 
03087         /* If there is eviction in progress, wait for it to finish. */
03088         if (unlikely(atomic_read(&exp->exp_obd->obd_evict_inprogress))) {
03089                 *lwi = LWI_INTR(NULL, NULL);
03090                 rc = l_wait_event(exp->exp_obd->obd_evict_inprogress_waitq,
03091                                   !atomic_read(&exp->exp_obd->
03092                                                    obd_evict_inprogress),
03093                                   lwi);
03094         }
03095 
03096         /* Check if client was evicted or reconnected already. */
03097         if (exp->exp_failed ||
03098             exp->exp_conn_cnt > lustre_msg_get_conn_cnt(req->rq_reqmsg)) {
03099                 rc = -ENOTCONN;
03100         } else {
03101                 if (req->rq_bulk_read)
03102                         rc = sptlrpc_svc_wrap_bulk(req, desc);
03103 
03104                 if ((exp->exp_connect_data.ocd_connect_flags &
03105                      OBD_CONNECT_BULK_MBITS) != 0)
03106                         req->rq_mbits = lustre_msg_get_mbits(req->rq_reqmsg);
03107                 else /* old version, bulk matchbits is rq_xid */
03108                         req->rq_mbits = req->rq_xid;
03109 
03110                 if (rc == 0)
03111                         rc = ptlrpc_start_bulk_transfer(desc);
03112         }
03113 
03114         if (rc < 0) {
03115                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "bulk %s failed: rc %d",
03116                           bulk2type(req), rc);
03117                 RETURN(rc);
03118         }
03119 
03120         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_MDS_SENDPAGE)) {
03121                 ptlrpc_abort_bulk(desc);
03122                 RETURN(0);
03123         }
03124 
03125         /* limit actual bulk transfer to bulk_timeout seconds */
03126         deadline = start + bulk_timeout;
03127         if (deadline > req->rq_deadline)
03128                 deadline = req->rq_deadline;
03129 
03130         do {
03131                 long timeoutl = deadline - cfs_time_current_sec();
03132                 cfs_duration_t timeout = timeoutl <= 0 ?
03133                                          CFS_TICK : cfs_time_seconds(timeoutl);
03134                 time_t  rq_deadline;
03135 
03136                 *lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT_INTERVAL(timeout, cfs_time_seconds(1),
03137                                             target_bulk_timeout, desc);
03138                 rc = l_wait_event(desc->bd_waitq,
03139                                   !ptlrpc_server_bulk_active(desc) ||
03140                                   exp->exp_failed ||
03141                                   exp->exp_conn_cnt >
03142                                   lustre_msg_get_conn_cnt(req->rq_reqmsg),
03143                                   lwi);
03144                 LASSERT(rc == 0 || rc == -ETIMEDOUT);
03145                 /* Wait again if we changed rq_deadline. */
03146                 rq_deadline = ACCESS_ONCE(req->rq_deadline);
03147                 deadline = start + bulk_timeout;
03148                 if (deadline > rq_deadline)
03149                         deadline = rq_deadline;
03150         } while ((rc == -ETIMEDOUT) &&
03151                  (deadline > cfs_time_current_sec()));
03152 
03153         if (rc == -ETIMEDOUT) {
03154                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "timeout on bulk %s after %ld%+lds",
03155                           bulk2type(req), deadline - start,
03156                           cfs_time_current_sec() - deadline);
03157                 ptlrpc_abort_bulk(desc);
03158         } else if (exp->exp_failed) {
03159                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "Eviction on bulk %s",
03160                           bulk2type(req));
03161                 rc = -ENOTCONN;
03162                 ptlrpc_abort_bulk(desc);
03163         } else if (exp->exp_conn_cnt >
03164                    lustre_msg_get_conn_cnt(req->rq_reqmsg)) {
03165                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "Reconnect on bulk %s",
03166                           bulk2type(req));
03167                 /* We don't reply anyway. */
03168                 rc = -ETIMEDOUT;
03169                 ptlrpc_abort_bulk(desc);
03170         } else if (desc->bd_failure) {
03171                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "network error on bulk %s",
03172                           bulk2type(req));
03173                 /* XXX should this be a different errno? */
03174                 rc = -ETIMEDOUT;
03175         } else {
03176                 if (req->rq_bulk_write)
03177                         rc = sptlrpc_svc_unwrap_bulk(req, desc);
03178                 if (rc == 0 && desc->bd_nob_transferred != desc->bd_nob) {
03179                         DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "truncated bulk %s %d(%d)",
03180                                   bulk2type(req), desc->bd_nob_transferred,
03181                                   desc->bd_nob);
03182                         /* XXX should this be a different errno? */
03183                         rc = -ETIMEDOUT;
03184                 }
03185         }
03186 
03187         RETURN(rc);
03188 }
03189 EXPORT_SYMBOL(target_bulk_io);
03190 
03191 #endif /* HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT */
